MAT 19:20 The young man says to Him: “I have kept all these things since my youth. What do I still lack?”
MAT 19:21 Jesus said to him, “If you want to be perfect, go sell your possessions and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come follow me.”
MAT 19:22 So upon hearing that word the young man went away sorrowful, for he had great possessions.
MAT 19:23 Then Jesus said to His disciples: “Assuredly I say to you that only with difficulty will a rich person enter into the kingdom of the heavens.
MAT 19:24 And again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter into the kingdom of God.”
MAT 19:25 Upon hearing it His disciples were really flabbergasted saying, “Who then can be saved?”
MAT 19:26 So looking at them Jesus said, “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”
MAT 19:27 Then Peter answered and said to Him: “See, we have left all and followed you. So what will we have?”
MAT 19:28 So Jesus said to them: “Assuredly I say to you that in the Regeneration, when the Son of the Man sits on the throne of His glory, you who have followed me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
MAT 19:29 And, everyone who left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or fields for my name's sake will receive a hundredfold, and will inherit life eternal.
MAT 19:30 But many ‘first’ will be last, and ‘last’ first.
MAT 20:1 “For the kingdom of the heavens is like a certain landowner who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.
MAT 20:2 And agreeing with the workers for a denarius a day he sent them into his vineyard.
MAT 20:3 And going out about the third hour [9 a.m.] he saw others standing idle in the marketplace.
MAT 20:4 And he said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard and I will give you whatever is right.’ So off they went.
MAT 20:5 He went out again about the sixth hour, and the ninth, and did the same.
MAT 20:6 Now about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing idle, and he says to them, ‘Why have you stood here idle all day?’
MAT 20:7 They say to him, ‘Because no one hired us.’ He says to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and you will receive whatever is right.’
MAT 20:8 So when evening had come the owner of the vineyard says to his foreman, ‘Call the workers and pay them their wage, beginning at the last to the first.’
MAT 20:9 The eleventh hour ones came and each received a denarius.
MAT 20:10 So when the first ones came they supposed that they would receive more; yet each of them also received a denarius.
MAT 20:11 When they received it they began grumbling against the landowner
MAT 20:12 saying, ‘These last worked only one hour, and you made them equal to us who bore the burden and the heat of the day!’
MAT 20:13 But in answer he said to one of them: ‘Friend, I am not wronging you. Did you not agree with me for a denarius?
MAT 20:14 Take what is yours and go. I wish to give to this last one just as to you.
MAT 20:15 Or is it not permissible for me to do what I want with what is mine? Is your eye evil because I am good?’
MAT 20:16 Just so the last will be first, and the first last. For many are called, but few are chosen.”
MAT 20:17 As Jesus was on His way to Jerusalem He took the twelve disciples aside on the road and said to them privately:
MAT 20:18 “Listen! We are going up to Jerusalem and the Son of the Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and scribes; and they will condemn Him to death,
MAT 20:19 and they will hand Him over to the Gentiles to mock, to scourge and to crucify. And on the third day He will rise!”
MAT 20:20 Then the mother of Zebedee's sons approached Him, with her sons, and kneeling down she asked something from Him.
MAT 20:21 So He said to her, “What do you wish?” She says to Him, “State that these my two sons may sit one on Your right and one on Your left in Your kingdom.”
MAT 20:22 But in answer Jesus said: “You (pl.) do not know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup which I am about to drink, or to be baptized with the baptism that I am being baptized with?” They say to Him, “We are able.”
MAT 20:23 And He says to them: “You will indeed drink my cup, and you will be baptized with the baptism that I am being baptized with, but to sit on my right and on my left is not mine to give; rather it is for those for whom it has been prepared by my Father.”
MAT 20:24 Now when the ten heard it they were indignant at the two brothers.
MAT 20:25 But summoning them Jesus said: “You know that the rulers of the nations lord it over them, and the great exercise authority over them;
MAT 20:26 but it must not be so among you. Rather, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,
MAT 20:27 and whoever wants to be first among you must be your slave;
MAT 20:28 just like the Son of the Man—He did not come to be served but to serve, and to give His life as a ransom for many.”
MAT 20:29 Now as they went on from Jericho a large crowd followed Him.
MAT 20:30 And then, two blind men sitting alongside the road and hearing, “Jesus is passing by!” cried out saying, “Have mercy on us, Lord, Son of David!”
MAT 20:31 So the crowd threatened them to be quiet, but they cried out all the more saying, “Have mercy on us, Lord, Son of David!!”
MAT 20:32 Jesus stopped, called them and said, “What do you want me to do for you?”
MAT 20:33 They say to Him, “Lord, that our eyes may be opened!”
MAT 20:34 So Jesus had compassion and touched their eyes, and immediately their eyes received sight, and they followed Him.
MAT 21:1 Now when they drew near to Jerusalem and came to Bethphage, opposite the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,
MAT 21:2 saying to them: “Go into the village opposite you and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her. Loose her and bring them to me.
MAT 21:3 And if anyone says anything to you, just say, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and immediately he will send them.”
MAT 21:4 Now all this happened so that what was spoken through the prophet should be fulfilled, namely:
MAT 21:5 “Say to the daughter of Zion, ‘Look, your King is coming to you, humble and mounted on a donkey, in fact, a young donkey, foal of a beast of burden.’ ”
MAT 21:6 So going and doing just as Jesus had commanded them,
MAT 21:7 the disciples brought the female donkey and the young donkey. And they placed their clothes on them and He sat down on them [the clothes].
MAT 21:8 And the very large crowd spread their clothes on the road, while others were cutting branches from the trees and spreading them on the road.
MAT 21:9 Then the crowds who went in front and those who followed kept crying out, saying: “Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest heaven!”
MAT 21:10 So when He came into Jerusalem the whole city was stirred up, saying, “Who is this?”
MAT 21:11 And the crowds kept saying, “This is Jesus, the prophet from Natsareth of Galilee.”
MAT 21:12 Jesus went into the temple of God and drove out all who were selling and buying in the temple, and He overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who sold the doves.
MAT 21:13 And He says to them, “It is written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you have made it ‘a cave of bandits’.”
MAT 21:14 And the lame and the blind came to Him in the temple, and He healed them.
MAT 21:15 But seeing the wonders that He did, and the children calling out in the temple and saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David!” the chief priests and the scribes became indignant
MAT 21:16 and said to Him, “Do you hear what these are saying?” So Jesus says to them: “Yes. Have you never read that ‘Out of the mouth of babies and nursing infants You have prepared praise for Yourself’?”
MAT 21:17 Leaving them behind He went out of the city to Bethany and lodged there.
MAT 21:18 Now in the early morning, as He returned to the city, He was hungry.
MAT 21:19 And seeing a lone fig tree by the road, He went up to it and found nothing on it, just leaves. And He says to it, “May you never again produce fruit!” And forthwith the fig tree started to wither.
MAT 21:20 And seeing it the disciples marveled saying, “How quickly the fig tree became withered!”
MAT 21:21 So in answer Jesus said to them: “Assuredly I say to you, if you (pl.) have faith and do not doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you should say to this mountain, ‘Be taken up and be thrown into the sea,’ it will happen.
MAT 21:22 And anything whatever you may ask in the believing prayer, you will receive.”
MAT 21:23 So He came into the temple, and as He was teaching the chief priests and the elders of the people approached Him saying, “By what kind of authority are you doing these things?” and “Who gave you this authority?”
MAT 21:24 But in answer Jesus said to them: “I also will ask you one question, which if you tell me, I also will tell you by what authority I do these things:
MAT 21:25 The baptism of John—where was it from; from heaven or from men?” So they reasoned among themselves saying: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say to us, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
MAT 21:26 But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the crowd, for all consider John as a prophet.”
MAT 21:27 So in answer to Jesus they said, “We do not know.” So He said to them: “Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.
MAT 21:28 “But what do you think? A certain man had two sons, and going to the first he said, ‘Son, go work today in my vineyard.’
MAT 21:29 But in answer he said, ‘I don't want to’ (but later he changed his mind and went).
MAT 21:30 And going to the other he said likewise. And in answer he said, ‘I go, Sir’; yet he did not go.
MAT 21:31 Which of the two did the will of the father?” They say to Him, “The first.” Jesus says to them: “Assuredly I say to you that the tax collectors and the prostitutes will go into the kingdom of God before you do.
MAT 21:32 For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him; but the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him, yet when you saw it you did not afterward repent, so as to believe him.
MAT 21:33 “Hear another parable: There was a certain landowner who planted a vineyard and set a hedge around it, dug a winepress in it and built a tower. And he leased it to farmers and went on a journey.
MAT 21:34 When vintage-time drew near he sent his servants to the farmers to receive his fruits.
MAT 21:35 But the farmers took his servants—one they beat, one they killed, one they stoned.
MAT 21:36 Again he sent other servants, more than the first, and they did to them likewise.
MAT 21:37 So finally he sent his son to them saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
MAT 21:38 But when the farmers saw the son they said among themselves: ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him and take possession of his inheritance.’
MAT 21:39 And taking him they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.
MAT 21:40 Therefore, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those farmers?”
MAT 21:41 They say to Him: “He will miserably destroy those miserable men! And he will lease the vineyard to other farmers who will render to him the fruits in their seasons.”
MAT 21:42 Jesus says to them: “Did you never read in the Scriptures: ‘A stone which the builders rejected, this one became the cornerstone. This was the Lord's doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?
MAT 21:43 Therefore I say to you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a nation producing the fruits of it.
MAT 21:44 Also, whoever falls upon this stone will be broken to pieces; but upon whomever it falls, it will grind him to powder.”
MAT 21:45 As the chief priests and Pharisees heard His parables they knew that He was speaking about them.
MAT 21:46 And although they wanted to seize Him, they were afraid of the crowds, because they considered Him as a prophet.
MAT 22:1 Jesus answered and spoke to them again in parables saying:
MAT 22:2 “The kingdom of the heavens is like a certain king who prepared a wedding feast for his son.
MAT 22:3 And he sent out his servants to call those who had been invited to the wedding feast, but they did not want to come.
MAT 22:4 Again he sent out other servants saying: ‘Say to those who have been invited: “See, I have prepared my dinner; my oxen and fatted cattle are butchered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding feast!” ’
MAT 22:5 Now the indifferent ones just took off—one to his own field, another to his business.
MAT 22:6 But the rest, seizing his servants mistreated and killed them!
MAT 22:7 So when that king heard about it he was furious; and sending his troops he destroyed those murderers and burned up their city.
MAT 22:8 “Then he says to his servants: ‘The wedding is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy.
MAT 22:9 So go on the roads leading out of town, and as many as you may find invite to the wedding feast.’
MAT 22:10 And going out on the roads those servants gathered together everyone they found, both evil and good; and the wedding hall was filled with guests.
MAT 22:11 But when the king came in to look at the guests, he saw there a man who had not been clothed with a wedding garment.
MAT 22:12 So he says to him, ‘Friend, how did you get in here without a wedding garment?’ And he was speechless.
MAT 22:13 Then the king said to the servants, ‘Tie him up hand and foot, take him away and throw him out into the darkness farthest away.’ There there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
MAT 22:14 For many are called, but few chosen.”
MAT 22:15 Then the Pharisees went and plotted how they might trap Him in some word.
MAT 22:16 So they send their disciples to Him, with the Herodians, saying: “Teacher, we know that you are truthful and teach the way of God in truth; and you are not impressed by anyone, for you do not look at people's faces.
MAT 22:17 So tell us, what do you think: is it lawful to pay tax to Caesar, or not?”
MAT 22:18 But perceiving their malignancy Jesus said: “Hypocrites! Why do you test me?
MAT 22:19 Show me the tax coin.” So they brought Him a denarius.
MAT 22:20 And He says to them, “Whose image and inscription is this?”
MAT 22:21 They say to Him, “Caesar's.” Then He says to them, “Render therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's!”
MAT 22:22 And hearing it they marveled, and leaving Him they went away.
MAT 22:23 The same day the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Him and asked Him
MAT 22:24 saying: “Teacher, Moses said that if someone dies having no children his brother must marry the widow and raise up offspring for his brother.
MAT 22:25 Now there were seven brothers among us. The first married and died, and having no offspring he left his widow to his brother.
MAT 22:26 So also the second, and the third, up to the seventh.
MAT 22:27 Last of all, the woman died too.
MAT 22:28 Therefore in the resurrection whose wife, of the seven, will she be? For they all had her.”
MAT 22:29 So in answer Jesus said to them: “You are deceived, not knowing the Scriptures nor the power of God!
MAT 22:30 For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels of God in heaven.
MAT 22:31 But concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was spoken to you by God saying,
MAT 22:32 ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? God is not God of dead people but of living.”
MAT 22:33 Now as the crowds heard Him they were astonished at His teaching.
MAT 22:34 Now when the Pharisees heard that He had silenced the Sadducees, they got together.
MAT 22:35 And one of them, a lawyer, testing Him, questioned and said,
MAT 22:36 “Teacher, which is the great commandment in the Law?”
MAT 22:37 So Jesus said to him: “ ‘You must love the Lord your God with your whole heart, and with your whole soul, and with your whole mind.’
MAT 22:38 This is the first and great commandment.
MAT 22:39 And the second is like it, ‘You must love your neighbor as yourself.’
MAT 22:40 On these two commandments hang the whole Law, and the Prophets.”
MAT 22:41 While the Pharisees were assembled, Jesus asked them
MAT 22:42 saying, “What do you think about the Christ; whose Son is He?” They say to Him, “David's.”
MAT 22:43 He says to them: “How then does David in the Spirit call Him ‘Lord’ saying,
MAT 22:44 ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right until I place your enemies as a footstool for your feet” ’?
MAT 22:45 Really now, if David calls Him ‘Lord’, how can He be his son?”
MAT 22:46 And no one was able to answer Him a word, nor from that day on did anyone dare to question Him anymore.
MAT 23:1 Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to His disciples
MAT 23:2 saying: “The scribes and the Pharisees are seated upon Moses' chair;
MAT 23:3 so whatever they may tell you to observe, you should observe and do; but do not do according to their deeds, for they say and do not do.
MAT 23:4 For they package loads that are heavy and hard to bear, and lay them on the shoulders of the people; but they themselves do not want to move them with one of their fingers.
MAT 23:5 “Rather, they do all their works in order to be seen by people. They make their phylacteries broad and the tassels on their garments large;
MAT 23:6 they love the place of honor at dinners and the first seats in the synagogues,
MAT 23:7 and the greetings in the marketplaces, namely to be called ‘Rabbi, Rabbi’ by the people.
MAT 23:8 “But you (pl.), do not be called ‘Rabbi’; because your Teacher is one, the Christ, and you are all brothers.
MAT 23:9 And do not call anyone on earth your ‘father’; because your Father is one, He who is in the heavens.
MAT 23:10 Neither be called leaders/guides; because your Leader is one, the Christ.
MAT 23:11 On the contrary, the greatest among you must be your servant.
MAT 23:12 And whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.
MAT 23:13 “Woe to you scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you devour the houses of the widows, while making long prayers as a pretense. Therefore you will receive a greater condemnation.
MAT 23:14 Woe to you scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!! Because you bar the entrance to the kingdom of the heavens in the face of the people; for you neither go in yourselves nor do you allow those who are trying to enter to go in.
MAT 23:15 Woe to you scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!!! Because you travel all over, land and sea, to make one convert, and when he joins up you make him twice as much a son of Hell as yourselves.
MAT 23:16 “Woe to you blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the temple, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the temple is obligated.’
MAT 23:17 Stupid and blind! For which is greater, the gold or the temple that sanctifies the gold?
MAT 23:18 And, ‘Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gift that is on it is obligated.’
MAT 23:19 Stupid and blind!! For which is greater, the gift or the altar that sanctifies the gift?
MAT 23:20 Therefore he who swears by the altar swears by it and by all the things on it.
MAT 23:21 And he who swears by the temple swears by it and by Him who used to dwell in it.
MAT 23:22 And he who swears by heaven swears by the throne of God and by Him who sits on it.
MAT 23:23 “Woe to you scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you pay a tithe of mint and dill and cummin, but have neglected the weightier items of the law: justice and mercy and faith. These it was obligatory to do, while not neglecting those.
MAT 23:24 Blind guides, who strain out a gnat but gulp down a camel!
MAT 23:25 “Woe to you scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!! Because you cleanse the outside of the cup and the dish, but inside they are full of plunder and injustice.
MAT 23:26 Blind Pharisee! First cleanse the inside of the cup and the dish, so that their outside may also be clean.
MAT 23:27 “Woe to you scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!!! Because you resemble whitewashed tombs, which indeed appear beautiful outwardly but inside are full of dead bones and of all uncleanness.
MAT 23:28 Just so, you also outwardly appear to be righteous to the people, but inside you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.
MAT 23:29 “Woe to you scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!!!! Because you build the tombs of the prophets and adorn the monuments of the righteous;
MAT 23:30 yet you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.’
MAT 23:31 Therefore you testify against yourselves that you are sons of those who murdered the prophets.
MAT 23:32 So fill up the measure of your fathers' guilt!
MAT 23:33 “Snakes! Brood of vipers! How can you escape from the condemnation of Hell?
MAT 23:34 So take note: I will send you prophets and wise men and Biblical scholars; some of them you will kill, even crucify; some of them you will flog in your synagogues and persecute from city to city
MAT 23:35 —so that upon you may come all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel up to the blood of Zechariah son of Berechiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
MAT 23:36 Assuredly I say to you that all these things will come upon this generation.
MAT 23:37 “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, she who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children, just like a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you did not want to.
MAT 23:38 Look, your house is left to you abandoned!
MAT 23:39 For I say to you, you will not see me again until you say, ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord’!”
MAT 24:1 So as Jesus was going out, departing from the temple, His disciples came up to show Him the buildings of the temple.
MAT 24:2 But Jesus said to them: “Do you not see all these things? Assuredly I say to you, absolutely not a single stone here will be left upon another, that will not be thrown down.”
MAT 24:3 Now as He was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to Him privately saying: “Tell us, when will these things be? And what will be the sign of Your coming and of the completion of the age?”
MAT 24:4 So in answer Jesus said to them: “Watch out, so that no one deceives you.
MAT 24:5 Because many will come in my name saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and they will deceive many.
MAT 24:6 You will be concerned when you hear of wars and rumors of wars; see to it that you not get worked up; for all of it has to happen, but the end is not yet.
MAT 24:7 For nation will be raised up against nation and kingdom against kingdom, and there will be famines and pestilences and earthquakes in various places;
MAT 24:8 but all these things are only a beginning of birth pains.
MAT 24:9 “Then they will hand you over to oppression and kill you, and you will be hated by all nations for my name's sake.
MAT 24:10 And then many will be offended, and they will betray one another and will hate one another.
MAT 24:11 And many false prophets will be raised up and they will deceive many.
MAT 24:12 And because of the increase of the lawlessness the love of the majority will grow cold.
MAT 24:13 So the one who perseveres to the end, he will be saved.
MAT 24:14 And this good news of the kingdom will be proclaimed in the whole inhabited earth as a witness to all the ethnic nations, and then the end will come.
MAT 24:15 “So then, when you (ye) see the ‘abomination of desolation’, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place” (let the reader understand),
MAT 24:16 “then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
MAT 24:17 Anyone on the housetop should not go down to take things out of his house,
MAT 24:18 and anyone in the field should not go back to get his cloak.
MAT 24:19 But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing a baby in those days!
MAT 24:20 And pray that your flight may not happen in winter or on a Sabbath.
MAT 24:21 Because then there will be a great tribulation, such as has never been since the beginning of the world until now, and never again will be.
MAT 24:22 And unless those days were cut short no flesh would be saved; but for the sake of the elect those days will be cut short.
MAT 24:23 Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, the Messiah is here!’ or ‘there!’ do not believe him.
MAT 24:24 Because false christs and false prophets will be raised up, and they will give great signs and wonders so as to deceive, if possible, even the elect.
MAT 24:25 See, I have told you beforehand.
MAT 24:26 So if they should say to you, ‘Look, He is in the wilderness!’ do not go out; ‘Look, in the secret rooms!’ do not believe it.
MAT 24:27 Because just as the lightning comes from east and shines to west, so also will be the coming of the Son of the Man;
MAT 24:28 for wherever the carcass may be there will be a gathering of vultures.
MAT 24:29 “Immediately after the tribulation of those days, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light, and the stars will fall from the heaven, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
MAT 24:30 And then the sign of the Son of the Man will appear in the sky, and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn—they will see the Son of the Man coming on the clouds of the heaven with power and great glory.
MAT 24:31 And He will send out His angels with a great sound of a trumpet and they will collect His elect from the four winds, from one extreme of the heavens to the other.
MAT 24:32 “Now learn this parable from the fig tree: when its branch has already become tender and it puts forth leaves, you know that the summer is near.
MAT 24:33 So you also, whenever you see all these things, know that it is near, at the doors!
MAT 24:34 Assuredly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.
MAT 24:35 The heaven and the earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
MAT 24:36 “But no one knows concerning that day and hour, not even the angels of the heavens, except my Father alone.
MAT 24:37 But just as were the days of Noah, so also will be the coming of the Son of the Man.
MAT 24:38 For just as they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, in the days before the flood until the day that Noah entered the ark,
MAT 24:39 and were not aware until the flood came and took all away, so also will be the coming of the Son of the Man.
MAT 24:40 Then two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other will be left.
MAT 24:41 Two women will be grinding at the mill; one will be taken and the other will be left.
MAT 24:42 So be watchful, because you (pl) do not know in what hour your Lord is coming.
MAT 24:43 But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what watch the thief was coming, he would have stayed awake and not allowed his house to be broken into.
MAT 24:44 Therefore you also be ready, because the Son of the Man is coming at an hour that you do not suppose.
MAT 24:45 “Who then is the faithful and prudent servant whom his lord placed over his corps of servants to give them food on schedule?
MAT 24:46 Blessed be that servant whom his master, when he comes, will find doing so.
MAT 24:47 Assuredly I say to you that he will place him over all his possessions.
MAT 24:48 But if that bad servant should say in his heart, ‘My lord is delaying his return,’
MAT 24:49 and should begin to beat his fellow servants, and to eat and drink with the drunkards,
MAT 24:50 the lord of that servant will come on a day when he is not looking for him and at an hour when he is not aware,
MAT 24:51 and will cut him in two and appoint his portion with the hypocrites. There, there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
MAT 25:1 “Then the kingdom of the heavens will be like ten virgins who, taking their lamps, went out to meet the bridegroom.
MAT 25:2 Now five of them were prudent and five foolish.
MAT 25:3 Those who were foolish, taking their lamps, did not take [extra] oil with them,
MAT 25:4 but the prudent ones took oil in their vessels along with their lamps.
MAT 25:5 Now while the bridegroom delayed they all dozed and slept,
MAT 25:6 but at midnight there was a shout: ‘Attention! The bridegroom is coming; go out to meet him.’
MAT 25:7 Then all those virgins got up and trimmed their lamps.
MAT 25:8 And the foolish ones said to the prudent, ‘Give us some of your oil, because our lamps are going out.’
MAT 25:9 But the prudent ones answered saying, ‘No, in case there not be enough for you and us; instead, go to those who sell and buy for yourselves.’
MAT 25:10 But while they went to buy, the bridegroom arrived, and the ones who were ready went in with him to the marriage feast—and the door was shut!
MAT 25:11 Later the other virgins arrived too saying, ‘Lord, lord, open for us!’
MAT 25:12 But in answer he said, ‘Assuredly I say to you, I do not know you.’
MAT 25:13 Therefore, keep alert, because you do not know the day nor the hour in which the Son of the Man is coming.
MAT 25:14 “Because the kingdom is also like a man about to go on a long journey, who called his own servants and entrusted his possessions to them.
MAT 25:15 To one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one, to each according to his own ability; and immediately he went on the journey.
MAT 25:16 So the one who received the five talents went and traded with them, and made another five talents.
MAT 25:17 So also the one who received the two gained another two as well.
MAT 25:18 But he who received the one went off and dug in the ground and hid his lord's silver.
MAT 25:19 “Then, after a long time, the lord of those servants comes and settles accounts with them.
MAT 25:20 “So the one who had received the five talents approached and brought five more talents saying, ‘Lord, you entrusted five talents to me; see, I gained five more talents besides them!’
MAT 25:21 His lord said to him: ‘Super, you good and faithful servant! You were faithful over a few things, I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’
MAT 25:22 So the one who had received the two talents also approached and said, ‘Lord, you entrusted two talents to me; see, I gained two more talents besides them!’
MAT 25:23 His lord said to him: ‘Super, you good and faithful servant! You were faithful over a few things, I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’
MAT 25:24 “Then he who had received the one talent also approached and said: ‘Lord, I knew that you are a hard man, reaping where you did not sow and gathering where you did not scatter.
MAT 25:25 And being afraid I went off and hid your talent in the ground; here, take what is yours.’
MAT 25:26 So in answer his lord said to him: ‘You wicked and lazy servant! You knew that I reap where I did not sow and gather where I did not scatter.
MAT 25:27 Therefore you were obligated to deposit my money with the bankers, and at my coming I would have received what is mine with interest.
MAT 25:28 Therefore, take the talent away from him and give it to the one having the ten talents.
MAT 25:29 For to everyone who has, more will be given, and he will have abundance; but the one who does not have, even what he thinks that he has will be taken away from him.
MAT 25:30 And throw out the useless servant, into the darkness farthest out!’ There, there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
MAT 25:31 “When the Son of the Man comes in His glory, and all the holy angels with Him, then He will sit on His throne of glory.
MAT 25:32 And all the nations will be gathered before Him, and He will separate them one from another, just as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
MAT 25:33 And the sheep He will place on His right, but the goats on His left.
MAT 25:34 Then the King will say to those on His right: ‘Come, you blessed of my Father, inherit the kingdom that was prepared for you at the foundation of the world.
MAT 25:35 For I was hungry and you gave me food; I was thirsty and you gave me drink; I was a stranger and you took me in;
MAT 25:36 I was naked and you clothed me; I was sick and you visited me; I was in prison and you came to me.’
MAT 25:37 Then the righteous will answer Him saying: ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you drink?
MAT 25:38 When did we see you a stranger and take you in, or naked and clothe you?
MAT 25:39 Or when did we see you sick or in prison and come to you?’
MAT 25:40 And in answer the King will say to them, ‘Assuredly I say to you, inasmuch as you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.’
MAT 25:41 “Then He will also say to those on His left: ‘Go away from me, you accursed ones, into the eternal fire that was prepared for the devil and his angels.
MAT 25:42 For I was hungry and you did not give me food; I was thirsty and you did not give me drink;
MAT 25:43 I was a stranger and you did not take me in; I was naked and you did not clothe me; I was sick and in prison and you did not visit me.’
MAT 25:44 Then they also will answer saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison and did not minister to you?’
MAT 25:45 Then He will answer them saying, ‘Assuredly I say to you, inasmuch as you did not do it to one of the least of these, neither did you do it to me.’
MAT 25:46 And they will go away into everlasting punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”
MAT 26:1 Now it happened, when Jesus had finished all these words, that He said to His disciples,
MAT 26:2 “You know that after two days the Passover takes place, and the Son of the Man will be handed over to be crucified.”
MAT 26:3 Then the chief priests, the scribes and the elders of the people assembled at the palace of the high priest, the one called Caiaphas,
MAT 26:4 and they plotted to seize Jesus by trickery and kill Him.
MAT 26:5 But they said, “Not during the feast, in order not to have an uproar among the people.”
MAT 26:6 Now when Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper,
MAT 26:7 a woman approached Him, having an alabaster flask of very expensive perfume, and she began to pour it on His head as He reclined at the table.
MAT 26:8 But upon seeing it His disciples were indignant saying: “Why this waste?
MAT 26:9 For this perfume could have been sold for a good deal and given to the poor.”
MAT 26:10 But being aware Jesus said to them: “Why are you bothering the woman? She has done something beautiful to me.
MAT 26:11 You will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me.
MAT 26:12 In putting this perfume on my body she did it with a view to my burial.
MAT 26:13 Assuredly I say to you, wherever this gospel may be proclaimed in the whole world, what this woman did will also be told in her memory.”
MAT 26:14 Then one of the twelve, the one called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
MAT 26:15 and said, “What are you willing to give me so that I deliver Him to you?” So they counted out to him thirty silver coins.
MAT 26:16 From then on he kept looking for an opportunity to betray Him.
MAT 26:17 Now on the first day of Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus saying to Him, “Where do you want us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”
MAT 26:18 So He said: “Go into the city to ‘you know who’ and say to him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is near, I will do the Passover with my disciples at your place.” ’ ”
MAT 26:19 And the disciples did as Jesus directed them and prepared the Passover.
MAT 26:20 When it was evening He was reclining at the table with the twelve.
MAT 26:21 And as they were eating He said, “Assuredly I say to you that one of you will betray me.”
MAT 26:22 This really upset them and they each began to say to Him, “It isn't me, is it, Lord?”
MAT 26:23 In answer He said: “It is the one who dipped his hand in the bowl with me, he will betray me.
MAT 26:24 The Son of the Man is really going just as it is written about Him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of the Man is betrayed! It would have been better for that man not to have been born.”
MAT 26:25 Then Judas, who was betraying Him, answered and said, “It isn't me, is it, Rabbi?” He says to him, “You said it!”
MAT 26:26 Now as they were eating, after taking the bread and blessing it, Jesus broke it, gave it to the disciples and said, “Take, eat; this is my body.”
MAT 26:27 And taking the cup and giving thanks He gave it to them saying: “Drink of it, all of you;
MAT 26:28 for this is my blood, that of the new covenant, that which is being shed on behalf of many for forgiveness of sins.
MAT 26:29 Furthermore, I tell you that I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father's kingdom.”
MAT 26:30 And after hymn-singing they went out to the Mount of Olives.
MAT 26:31 Then Jesus says to them: “All of you will be caused to stumble because of me this night, for it is written: ‘I will strike the Shepherd and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
MAT 26:32 But after I am raised I will go before you to Galilee.”
MAT 26:33 Peter answered and said to Him, “Even if everyone else is caused to stumble because of you, I will never be caused to stumble.”
MAT 26:34 Jesus said to him, “Assuredly I say to you that this night, before any rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”
MAT 26:35 Peter says to Him, “Even if I have to die with you, I will not deny you!” And all the other disciples said the same.
MAT 26:36 Then Jesus comes with them to a place called Gethsemane, and He says to the disciples, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”
MAT 26:37 And taking Peter and the two sons of Zebedee along He began to be troubled and distressed.
MAT 26:38 Then Jesus says to them: “My soul is in anguish, to the point of death. Stay here and watch with me.”
MAT 26:39 And going a little farther He fell on His face and prayed saying, “My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass me by; nevertheless not as I wish, but as you do.”
MAT 26:40 Then He comes to the disciples and finds them sleeping, and He says to Peter: “So, you (pl.) were not able to watch with me one hour!
MAT 26:41 Watch and pray, so that you do not enter into temptation. The spirit on its part is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
MAT 26:42 And going away a second time He prayed saying, “My Father, if this cup cannot pass from me unless I drink it, let your will be done.”
MAT 26:43 And coming He finds them sleeping again, because their eyes had been weighed down.
MAT 26:44 So leaving them He went away and prayed a third time, saying the same thing.
MAT 26:45 Then He comes to His disciples and says to them: “Sleep some more and take your rest! Actually, the hour is here and the Son of the Man is being betrayed into sinners' hands.
MAT 26:46 Get up, let's go; see, the one who is betraying me has come!”
MAT 26:47 And while He was still speaking, there was Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a large crowd with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests and elders of the people.
MAT 26:48 (Now His betrayer had given them a sign saying, “Whomever I kiss, it is He; take Him!”)
MAT 26:49 And he went right up to Jesus and said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.
MAT 26:50 So Jesus said to him, “Friend, what brings you here?” Then approaching they laid hands on Jesus and took Him.
MAT 26:51 And then, one of those with Jesus stretched out his hand and drew his sword, and striking the servant of the high priest he cut off his ear!
MAT 26:52 But Jesus says to him: “Put your sword back into its place, for all who take the sword will die by the sword.
MAT 26:53 Do you actually suppose that I cannot call upon my Father right now and He will place beside me more than twelve legions of angels?
MAT 26:54 But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that it has to happen this way?”
MAT 26:55 At that time Jesus said to the crowd: “Have you come out with swords and clubs, as against a bandit, to arrest me? I used to sit daily with you in the temple, teaching, and you did not seize me.
MAT 26:56 But all this has happened so that the Scriptures of the prophets should be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples forsook Him and ran away.
MAT 26:57 So those who had seized Jesus led Him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.
MAT 26:58 Now Peter was following Him at a distance, up to the high priest's courtyard. And going inside he sat down with the attendants, to see the end.
MAT 26:59 The chief priests and the elders, in fact the whole Council, kept looking for false witnesses against Jesus so that they could put Him to death,
MAT 26:60 but did not find any. Even though many false witnesses came forward, they did not find any. But at last two false witnesses came forward
MAT 26:61 and said, “This fellow said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and to rebuild it in three days.’ ”
MAT 26:62 And standing up the high priest said to Him: “Do you answer nothing? What is it that these men are testifying against you?”
MAT 26:63 But Jesus kept silent. So reacting the high priest said to Him, “I put you under oath by the Living God so that you tell us if you are the Messiah, the Son of God!”
MAT 26:64 Jesus says to him: “You said it. Furthermore, I tell you, hereafter you will see the Son of the Man sitting at the Power's right, and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
MAT 26:65 Then the high priest tore his clothes saying: “He has blasphemed! Why do we still need witnesses? See, now you have heard His blasphemy!
MAT 26:66 What do you think?” So in answer they said, “He deserves death!”
MAT 26:67 Then they spat in His face and punched Him, while others slapped Him
MAT 26:68 saying, “Messiah, prophesy to us! Who is the one who hit you?”
MAT 26:69 Now Peter sat outside in the courtyard. And a certain servant girl approached him saying, “You too were with Jesus the Galilean.”
MAT 26:70 But he denied before them all saying, “I don't know what you are saying.”
MAT 26:71 And having gone out to the gateway, another girl saw him and says to those who were there, “This fellow also was with Jesus the Natsorean.”
MAT 26:72 And he denied again, with an oath, “I do not know the man!”
MAT 26:73 But a little later the bystanders came up and said to Peter, “Really, you too are one of them, because your very accent gives you away!”
MAT 26:74 Then he began to curse and to swear, “I do not know the man!!” And immediately a rooster crowed.
MAT 26:75 And Peter remembered the word that Jesus had said to him, “Before any rooster crows, you will deny me three times.” And going out he cried bitterly.
MAT 27:1 When early morning came, all the chief priests and elders plotted against Jesus to kill Him.
MAT 27:2 And having bound Him they went and handed Him over to Pontius Pilate, the governor.
MAT 27:3 (Then Judas, His betrayer, seeing that He had been condemned, felt regret and returned the thirty silver coins to the chief priests and elders
MAT 27:4 saying, “I sinned, by betraying innocent blood.” But they said: “What do we care? It's your problem!”
MAT 27:5 So throwing the silver down in the sanctuary he left, and went and hanged himself!
MAT 27:6 Then the chief priests took the coins and said, “It isn't lawful to put them into the treasury, being blood money.”
MAT 27:7 So after consultation they bought the potter's field with them, as a burial ground for strangers.
MAT 27:8 Therefore that field has been called ‘field of blood’ to this day.
MAT 27:9 Then was fulfilled what was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, namely: “And they took the thirty silver coins, the value of the one who was priced, whom some of the children of Israel priced,
MAT 27:10 and they gave them for the potter's field, just as the Lord directed me.”)
MAT 27:11 So Jesus stood before the governor. And the governor asked Him saying, “Are you the king of the Jews?” Jesus said to him, “As you say.”
MAT 27:12 But although the chief priests and elders kept accusing Him, He answered nothing.
MAT 27:13 Then Pilate says to Him, “Don't you hear all that they are saying against you?”
MAT 27:14 But He did not answer him, not even one word, so that the governor was really amazed.
MAT 27:15 Now at the feast the governor was accustomed to release one prisoner to the crowd, whomever they wanted.
MAT 27:16 Just then they had a notorious prisoner called Barabbas.
MAT 27:17 So while they were assembled Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to release to you, Barabbas or Jesus who is called Messiah?”
MAT 27:18 For he knew that they had handed Him over through envy.
MAT 27:19 Now as he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent to him saying, “Have nothing to do with that righteous man, because I suffered a great deal in a dream today because of Him.”
MAT 27:20 But the chief priests and elders had persuaded the crowds that they should ask for Barabbas, but destroy Jesus.
MAT 27:21 So the governor spoke up and said to them, “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?” And they said, “Barabbas!”
MAT 27:22 Pilate says to them, “What then shall I do with Jesus who is called Messiah?” They all say to him, “Let Him be crucified!”
MAT 27:23 So the governor said, “But, what evil did He do?” But they kept yelling all the more saying, “Let Him be crucified!!”
MAT 27:24 When Pilate saw that nothing was being gained but rather a riot was starting, he took water and washed his hands in front of the crowd saying: “I am innocent of the blood of this righteous man. It's your problem!”
MAT 27:25 So in answer all the people said, “His blood be upon us and upon our children!”
MAT 27:26 Then he released Barabbas to them, but Jesus, after flogging Him, he delivered to be crucified.
MAT 27:27 Then the governor's soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole garrison around Him.
MAT 27:28 They stripped Him and put a scarlet cloak on Him.
MAT 27:29 They plaited a crown out of thorns and put it on His head, and a reed in His right hand; and kneeling before Him they would mock Him saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
MAT 27:30 Spitting on Him they took the reed and hit Him repeatedly on the head.
MAT 27:31 After they had mocked Him they took the cloak off Him and put His own clothes back on; and they led Him away to be crucified.
MAT 27:32 Now as they went out they found a man of Cyrene, named Simon; they compelled him to carry His cross.
MAT 27:33 Upon arriving at a place called Golgotha, which means ‘place of a skull’,
MAT 27:34 they gave Him sour wine mixed with gall to drink; but having tasted it He would not drink.
MAT 27:35 Having crucified Him they divided up His clothes by casting lots.
MAT 27:36 And sitting down there they guarded Him.
MAT 27:37 And they put the charge against Him over His head in writing: THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
MAT 27:38 Then they crucified two bandits with Him, one on His right and one on His left.
MAT 27:39 And the passers-by kept blaspheming Him, wagging their heads
MAT 27:40 and saying: “You who destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days, save yourself!” “If you are ‘Son of God’, come down from the cross!”
MAT 27:41 Likewise the chief priests also, mocking with the scribes and elders and Pharisees, said:
MAT 27:42 “He saved others; himself he cannot save!” “If he is ‘King of Israel’ let him come down from the cross now and we will believe him!”
MAT 27:43 “He trusted in God; let Him rescue him now, if He wants him; for he said, ‘I am God's Son.’ ”
MAT 27:44 Even the bandits who were crucified with Him were reviling Him in the same way.
MAT 27:45 Now from the sixth hour until the ninth hour a darkness came over all the land.
MAT 27:46 And about the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice saying, “Eli, Eli, lima sabachtani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have You abandoned me?”
MAT 27:47 So upon hearing it some of the bystanders said, “This man is calling Elijah.”
MAT 27:48 Right then one of them ran and took a sponge, filled it with sour wine, put it on a reed and started to give Him a drink;
MAT 27:49 but the rest said: “Don't! Let's see if Elijah comes to save Him.”
MAT 27:50 Then Jesus called out again with a great shout and dismissed His spirit.
MAT 27:51 And then, the veil of the temple was ripped in two from top to bottom! And the earth was shaken, and the rocks were split,
MAT 27:52 and the graves were opened. (And many bodies, of the saints who had fallen asleep, were raised;
MAT 27:53 and coming forth out of the graves after His resurrection, they entered the holy city and were made visible to many.)
MAT 27:54 Now when the centurion and those with him guarding Jesus saw the earthquake and all that happened they were scared stiff and said, “This Man really was the Son of God!”
MAT 27:55 Many women who followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering to Him, were also there looking on from a distance;
MAT 27:56 among whom were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
MAT 27:57 Now at evening there appeared a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who himself had also become a disciple of Jesus.
MAT 27:58 This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate ordered that the body be given.
MAT 27:59 So taking the body Joseph wrapped it in clean linen cloth
MAT 27:60 and placed it in his own new tomb that he had cut out of the rock. Then he rolled a large stone against the door of the tomb and left.
MAT 27:61 And Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the grave.
MAT 27:62 The next day, which is after the Preparation, the chief priests and the Pharisees went together to Pilate
MAT 27:63 saying: “Sir, we remember that that deceiver, while still alive, said, ‘After three days I am going to rise.’
MAT 27:64 Therefore command that the grave be made secure until the third day, lest His disciples come by night and steal Him and say to the people, ‘He was raised from the dead,’ and the last deception will be worse than the first.”
MAT 27:65 So Pilate said to them, “You have a guard; go make it as secure as you can!”
MAT 27:66 So they went and secured the grave with the guard, having sealed the stone.
MAT 28:1 Now after the Sabbath, at the dawning of the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, came to see the tomb.
MAT 28:2 Now then, a big earthquake had occurred, because an angel of the Lord, descending out of heaven, had come and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat on it!
MAT 28:3 And his appearance was like lightning and his clothing as white as snow.
MAT 28:4 So the guards were shaken for fear of him, and became like dead men.
MAT 28:5 Now the angel spoke up and said to the women: “Do not be afraid! I know that you are looking for the Jesus who was crucified.
MAT 28:6 He is not here, because He is risen, just like He said! Come, see the place where the Lord was lying.
MAT 28:7 Now go quickly and tell His disciples that He is risen from the dead; and get this, He is going before you into Galilee; there you will see Him. There, I have told you!”
MAT 28:8 So they went out quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to report to His disciples.
MAT 28:9 But as they were going to report to His disciples, wow, Jesus met them saying, “Rejoice!” So approaching, they held His feet and worshiped Him.
MAT 28:10 Then Jesus says to them: “Do not be afraid! Go report to my brothers that they must go to Galilee, and there they will see me.”
MAT 28:11 Now while they were going, get this, some of the guard went into the city and reported to the chief priests all that had happened.
MAT 28:12 When they had met with the elders and consulted together, they gave plenty of money to the soldiers
MAT 28:13 saying: “Say that his disciples came at night and stole him while you were sleeping.
MAT 28:14 And should this get to the governor, we will persuade him and make you safe.”
MAT 28:15 So taking the money they did as they were instructed. Their tale is widely spread among the Jews until this day.
MAT 28:16 The eleven disciples went into Galilee to the mountain that Jesus had indicated to them.
MAT 28:17 When they saw Him they worshiped Him; but some doubted.
MAT 28:18 And approaching Jesus asserted to them saying: “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
MAT 28:19 As you go, make disciples in all ethnic nations: baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit;
MAT 28:20 teaching them to obey everything that I commanded you; and take note, I am with you every day, until the end of the age!” Amen.
MAR 1:1 A beginning of the Gospel of Jesus Christ, Son of God!
MAR 1:2 As it is written in the prophets —“Take note, I am sending my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.”
MAR 1:3 “A voice calling out: ‘In the wilderness prepare the way of the Lord, make His paths straight!’ ”—
MAR 1:4 John started baptizing in the wilderness and proclaiming a baptism of repentance for forgiveness of sins.
MAR 1:5 Well, the whole Judean countryside and the Jerusalemites started going out to him, and were all being baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.
MAR 1:6 Now John was clothed with camel's hair and with a leather belt around his waist; and he was eating locusts and wild honey.
MAR 1:7 And he was proclaiming: “After me my Superior is coming, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to stoop down and loosen.
MAR 1:8 I indeed baptized you with water, but He will baptize you with Holy Spirit.”
MAR 1:9 Well it happened in those days that Jesus came from Natsareth of Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
MAR 1:10 And immediately upon coming up from the water He saw the heavens being torn open and the Spirit, like a dove, descending upon Him.
MAR 1:11 And a Voice came from the heavens: “You are my Son, the beloved, in whom I am well pleased!”
MAR 1:12 Immediately the Spirit impelled Him into the wilderness.
MAR 1:13 And He was there in the wilderness forty days being tested by Satan, and was with the wild animals; and the angels were ministering to Him.
MAR 1:14 Now after John was put in prison, Jesus went into Galilee proclaiming the Gospel of the Kingdom of God,
MAR 1:15 and saying: “The time has been fulfilled and the Kingdom of God has approached. Repent and believe in the Gospel.”
MAR 1:16 Then, as He was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew his brother, of Simon, casting a circular net onto the water, for they were fishermen.
MAR 1:17 So Jesus said to them: “Come, follow me and I will turn you into fishers of men.”
MAR 1:18 At once they left their nets and followed Him.
MAR 1:19 And going on from there a little ways He saw James, son of Zebedee, and his brother John; they were in their boat mending their nets.
MAR 1:20 Right away He called them, and leaving their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men they followed Him.
MAR 1:21 Then they went into Capernaum. The very next Sabbath He entered the synagogue and began to teach.
MAR 1:22 And they kept on being amazed at His teaching, because He was teaching them as one having authority, and not like the scribes.
MAR 1:23 Now there was a man in their synagogue with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,
MAR 1:24 saying: “Hey, what do you want with us, Jesus Natsarene?! Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
MAR 1:25 So Jesus rebuked him saying: “Shut up and get out of him!”
MAR 1:26 The unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.
MAR 1:27 And all were astounded, so that they questioned among themselves, saying: “What is this? What can this new doctrine be? Because with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him!”
MAR 1:28 So His fame spread directly into the whole surrounding area of Galilee.
MAR 1:29 Immediately upon exiting the synagogue they went into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
MAR 1:30 Simon's mother-in-law was lying down with a fever, so without delay they told Him about her.
MAR 1:31 So He went and grasping her hand lifted her up; immediately the fever left her and she began to serve them.
MAR 1:32 That evening, when the sun had set, they started bringing to Him all who were sick and the demonized.
MAR 1:33 So much so that the whole town was gathered at the door,
MAR 1:34 and He healed many who were sick with various diseases and cast out many demons; and He did not allow the demons to speak, because they knew He was Messiah.
MAR 1:35 Now very early, still night, He got up, slipped out, and went off to a solitary place, where He was praying.
MAR 1:36 Simon and those with him hunted for Him,
MAR 1:37 and upon finding Him they said to Him, “Everyone is looking for you.”
MAR 1:38 But He said to them: “Let us go to the neighboring towns, so I can preach there also; that is why I have come.”
MAR 1:39 He was constantly preaching in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and also casting out demons.
MAR 1:40 A leper came to Him, imploring Him, kneeling before Him and saying to Him, “If you want to, you are able to cleanse me.”
MAR 1:41 So being moved with compassion, Jesus stretched out His hand and touched him, and said to him: “I want to; be cleansed!”
MAR 1:42 And when He said this, immediately the leprosy left him, and he was cleansed.
MAR 1:43 And He sent him away at once, sternly warning him,
MAR 1:44 by saying: “See that you say nothing to anyone; but go, show yourself to the priest and offer for your cleansing the things that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
MAR 1:45 However he went out and began to proclaim it freely, spreading the news, so that He was no longer able to enter a town openly, but remained outside in deserted places; yet they kept coming to Him from all over.
MAR 2:1 Well a few days later, He again entered Capernaum, and it was heard that He was at home.
MAR 2:2 Without delay so many were gathered together that there was no more room, not even around the door, and He was speaking the Word to them.
MAR 2:3 Then four men came, carrying a paralytic to Him.
MAR 2:4 And not being able to get near Him because of the crowd, they removed the roof where He was; upon breaking through they lowered the pallet on which the paralytic was lying.
MAR 2:5 So seeing their faith Jesus says to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven you.”
MAR 2:6 Now some of the scribes were sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts:
MAR 2:7 “Why does this guy speak blasphemies like that? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
MAR 2:8 Immediately Jesus perceived in His spirit what they were reasoning within themselves and said to them: “Why are you reasoning these things in your hearts?
MAR 2:9 Which is easier: to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins have been forgiven’, or to say, ‘Get up, pick up your pallet and start walking!’?
MAR 2:10 But so that you may know that the Son of the Man has authority on the earth to forgive sins”—He says to the paralytic:
MAR 2:11 “To you I say, get up, pick up your pallet and go to your house!”
MAR 2:12 So forthwith he got up, picked up his pallet and went out in front of them all; so that all were amazed and glorified God, saying, “We never saw anything like this!”
MAR 2:13 Then He went out again by the sea; and the whole crowd came to Him, and He began to teach them.
MAR 2:14 As He passed by, He saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax office, and He said to him, “Follow me!” So he got up and followed Him.
MAR 2:15 Now it happened, as He was reclining at the table in his house, that many tax collectors and sinners joined Jesus and His disciples at the table; for there were many and they followed Him.
MAR 2:16 The scribes and the Pharisees, seeing Him eating with the tax collectors and sinners, said to His disciples, “Why is it that He is eating and drinking with the tax collectors and sinners?”
MAR 2:17 Upon hearing it Jesus said to them: “It is not the healthy who have need of a doctor, but those who are sick. I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
MAR 2:18 Now John's disciples and those of the Pharisees were fasting; and they came and said to Him, “Why do John's disciples and those of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples do not?”
MAR 2:19 So Jesus said to them: “Can the groomsmen fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom to themselves they cannot fast.
MAR 2:20 But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast, in those days.
MAR 2:21 “Further, no one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, or else the new tears away some of the old, and a worse hole results.
MAR 2:22 And no one puts new wine into old wineskins, or else the new wine bursts the wineskins, the wine spills out and the skins will be ruined; rather, new wine must be put into new wineskins.”
MAR 2:23 Now it happened, on a Sabbath, that He was passing through some grain fields, and His disciples began to make a path, picking the heads of grain.
MAR 2:24 So the Pharisees said to Him, “Just look, why are they doing on a Sabbath that which is not permitted?”
MAR 2:25 And He said to them: “Did you never read what David did when he was in need and hungry, he and those with him?
MAR 2:26 How he entered the house of God (making Abiathar high priest) and ate the consecrated bread, which only priests are permitted to eat, and shared it with those who were with him?”
MAR 2:27 Then He said to them: “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.
MAR 2:28 Therefore the Son of the Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”
MAR 3:1 Another time He went into the synagogue, and there was a man there with a withered hand.
MAR 3:2 So they watched Him closely, whether He would heal him on the Sabbath, so that they might accuse Him.
MAR 3:3 Well, He says to the man with the withered hand, “Come out in the middle!”
MAR 3:4 Then He said to them: “Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save life or to kill?” But they remained silent.
MAR 3:5 After looking around at them with anger, being grieved at the hardness of their hearts, He says to the man, “Stretch out your hand!” So he stretched, and his hand was restored as healthy as the other!
MAR 3:6 Then the Pharisees went straight out, and with the Herodians started hatching a plot against Him, how they might destroy Him.
MAR 3:7 Jesus withdrew with His disciples to the sea; and a large crowd from Galilee followed Him—also from Judea,
MAR 3:8 from Jerusalem, from Idumea and beyond Jordan; even those around Tyre and Sidon. A huge crowd came to Him, having heard the sorts of things He kept doing.
MAR 3:9 So He told His disciples that a small boat should be kept ready for Him because of the crowd, lest they should press in on Him.
MAR 3:10 Because He had healed many, so that as many as had afflictions were pushing toward Him so as to touch Him.
MAR 3:11 And the unclean spirits—whenever one saw Him, he would fall down before Him and cry out, saying, “You are the son of God!”
MAR 3:12 And He kept giving them strict orders that they should not make Him known.
MAR 3:13 He went up on the mountain and summoned those whom He wanted, and they came to Him.
MAR 3:14 He appointed twelve, that they might be with Him and that He might send them out to preach
MAR 3:15 —also to have authority to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons:
MAR 3:16 namely Peter (a name He gave to Simon);
MAR 3:17 James son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James (and a name He gave to them was Boanerges, that is, ‘Sons of thunder’);
MAR 3:18 Andrew, Phillip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Cananite;
MAR 3:19 and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed Him.
MAR 3:20 Then they went into a house; and again a multitude gathered, so that they were not even able to eat bread.
MAR 3:21 Well upon hearing this His family came to apprehend Him, because they were saying, “He is out of his mind!”
MAR 3:22 Then some scribes who had come down from Jerusalem started saying, “He has Beelzebul,” and “It is by the ruler of the demons that he casts out demons.”
MAR 3:23 So summoning them He started saying to them in parables: “How can Satan cast out Satan?
MAR 3:24 If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
MAR 3:25 And if a household is divided against itself, that household cannot stand.
MAR 3:26 And if Satan has risen up against himself and become divided, he cannot stand, but is finished.
MAR 3:27 No one can plunder the strong man's goods, invading his house, unless he first binds the strong man—then he may plunder the house.
MAR 3:28 “Assuredly I say to you: all the sins of the sons of men can be forgiven, including whatever blasphemies they may utter;
MAR 3:29 but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is subject to eternal condemnation”
MAR 3:30 —because they were saying, “He has an unclean spirit.”
MAR 3:31 Then His brothers and His mother came, and standing outside they sent to Him, calling Him.
MAR 3:32 A crowd was sitting around Him; so they said to Him, “Look, your mother and your brothers and your sisters are outside asking for you.”
MAR 3:33 He answered them saying, “Who is my mother or my brothers?”
MAR 3:34 And looking around at those seated in a circle around Him He said: “Behold my mother and my brothers!
MAR 3:35 Because whoever does the will of God, the same is my brother, my sister, my mother.”
MAR 4:1 Once again He began to teach beside the sea. And a large crowd was gathered to Him, so that He got into the boat and sat down, out on the water, while the whole crowd was on the land, at the water's edge.
MAR 4:2 Then He began teaching them many things by parables and said to them in His teaching:
MAR 4:3 “Listen! Yes, a sower went out to sow.
MAR 4:4 And it happened, as he sowed, that some seed fell along the path, and the birds came and devoured it.
MAR 4:5 Some fell on the rocky area where it did not have much soil, and it sprang up quickly because it had no depth of soil.
MAR 4:6 But upon the sun's rising it was scorched, and because it had no root it was withered up.
MAR 4:7 And some fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up and smothered it, and it yielded no fruit.
MAR 4:8 And some fell into the good ground, and coming up and growing it started to produce fruit—yielding thirty times as much, sixty times as much, even a hundred times as much.”
MAR 4:9 Then He said, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”
MAR 4:10 But when He was alone, those who were around Him, with the twelve, asked Him about the parable.
MAR 4:11 So He said to them: “To you it has been given to know the mystery of the Kingdom of God; but to those who are outside, everything is being given in parables,
MAR 4:12 so that: ‘Seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; so that they should not return and their sins be forgiven them.’ ”
MAR 4:13 Then He said to them: “Don't you understand this parable? How then will you understand all the parables?
MAR 4:14 The sower sows the Word.
MAR 4:15 These are the ones where the Word is sown along the path: as soon as they hear it, Satan comes and takes away the Word that was sown in their hearts.
MAR 4:16 Similarly, these are the ones sown on the rocky area: as soon as they hear the Word they receive it with joy,
MAR 4:17 but since they have no root in themselves they are temporary—when oppression or persecution comes because of the Word, they quickly fall away.
MAR 4:18 And these are the ones sown among the thorns: they hear the Word,
MAR 4:19 but the worries of this age, the deceitfulness of wealth, and the undue desires for other things come in and smother the Word, and it becomes unfruitful.
MAR 4:20 And these are the ones sown on the good ground: such people hear the Word, welcome it and produce fruit—thirty times as much, sixty times as much, even a hundred times as much.”
MAR 4:21 Also He said to them: “The lamp is not brought to be put under a box or under a bed, is it? Is it not to be placed on its stand?
MAR 4:22 For there is no ‘hidden’ that may not be exposed, nor has anything been concealed but that it should come to light.
MAR 4:23 If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!”
MAR 4:24 Then He said to them: “Pay attention to what you hear. With the same measure you use it will be measured to you in return; and to you who hear, more will be added.
MAR 4:25 Because whoever has, to him more will be given; whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.”
MAR 4:26 He also said: “The Kingdom of God is as if a man should scatter the seed on the ground
MAR 4:27 and should sleep and get up night and day, and the seed should sprout and grow, he himself does not know how.
MAR 4:28 All by itself the earth produces fruit: first a shoot, then a head of grain, then full grain in the head.
MAR 4:29 But as soon as the grain is ready, he sends in the sickle, because the harvest has come.”
MAR 4:30 Again He said: “To what shall we compare the Kingdom of God, or with what sort of parable should we illustrate it?
MAR 4:31 It is like a mustard seed, that when it is sown on the ground is the smallest of all such seeds,
MAR 4:32 yet when it is sown, it grows up and becomes larger than all the garden herbs and produces big branches, so that the birds of the air are able to rest in its shade.”
MAR 4:33 It was with many such parables that He was speaking the word to them, as they were able to hear it.
MAR 4:34 But apart from a parable He did not speak to them; privately, however, He would explain everything to His disciples.
MAR 4:35 On the same day, when evening had come, He said to them, “Let us go across to the other side.”
MAR 4:36 Since He was already in the boat, they took off with Him, leaving the crowd behind (other little boats were also with Him).
MAR 4:37 Well a strong cyclonic wind came up, such that the waves beat into the boat, so that it was already filling up.
MAR 4:38 But He was on the poop deck, sleeping on the cushion; so they awakened Him and said to Him, “Teacher, don't you care that we are perishing?”
MAR 4:39 Then, having been awakened, He rebuked the wind and said to the sea, “Shut up; be muzzled!” So the wind stopped and there was a complete calm.
MAR 4:40 And He said to them: “Why are you so afraid? How is it that you have no faith?”
MAR 4:41 They were terrified and started saying to one another, “Who can this be, that even the wind and the sea obey Him!?”
MAR 5:1 Then they came to the other side of the sea, to the region of the Gadarenes.
MAR 5:2 And when He got out of the boat, right away a man with an unclean spirit met Him, coming from the tombs.
MAR 5:3 —He had his dwelling among the tombs. No one could bind him, not even with chains,
MAR 5:4 because he had often been bound with shackles and chains, only to have had the chains torn apart by him, and the shackles broken in pieces; no one had been strong enough to tame him.
MAR 5:5 Always, night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying out and cutting himself with stones.—
MAR 5:6 When he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and kneeled down to Him,
MAR 5:7 and with a loud cry he said: “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I implore you by God, don't torment me!”
MAR 5:8 Because He was saying to him, “You unclean spirit, come out of the man!”
MAR 5:9 Then He asked him, “What is your name?” And he answered, saying, “Legion is my name, because we are many.”
MAR 5:10 He started begging Him repeatedly that He would not send them out of that region.
MAR 5:11 Now a large herd of pigs was feeding there on the hillside.
MAR 5:12 So all the demons begged Him saying, “Send us into the pigs, so that we may enter them.”
MAR 5:13 And forthwith Jesus gave them permission; and coming out the unclean spirits went into the pigs (there were about two thousand); but the herd rushed down the steep bank into the sea, and they were drowned by the sea.
MAR 5:14 So those who were tending the pigs ran off and reported it in the town and the countryside. And they went out to see what it was that had happened.
MAR 5:15 They came to Jesus and observed the man who had been demonized, who had the legion, sitting and clothed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.
MAR 5:16 Those who had seen it related to them how it happened to the demonized man, and about the pigs.
MAR 5:17 Then they began to implore Him to depart from their borders.
MAR 5:18 Well upon His getting into the boat, the man who had been demonized started begging Him that he might be with Him.
MAR 5:19 But Jesus did not permit him, but said to him, “Go home to your family and report to them how much the Lord has done for you; and He had mercy on you.”
MAR 5:20 So he departed and began to proclaim in Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him; and all were marveling.
MAR 5:21 Now when Jesus had crossed over again by boat to the other side, a large crowd gathered to Him; and He was by the sea.
MAR 5:22 And then, one of the synagogue rulers, named Jairus, comes, and upon finding Him he falls at His feet
MAR 5:23 and pleads earnestly with Him, saying, “My little daughter is at the point of death; do come and lay your hands on her so that she may be saved, and she will live.”
MAR 5:24 So He went with him. A large crowd was also following Him, and they were pressing around Him.
MAR 5:25 Now a certain woman—who had been bleeding for twelve years,
MAR 5:26 and had suffered many things under many doctors, and had spent all that she had, yet instead of getting better she grew worse—
MAR 5:27 when she heard about Jesus, she came from behind in the crowd and touched His garment.
MAR 5:28 (She had kept saying, “If I can just touch His clothes, I will be healed.”)
MAR 5:29 Immediately the flow of her blood was dried up, and she knew in her body that she was healed from the affliction.
MAR 5:30 And instantly Jesus perceived within Himself that some power had gone out of Him, and turning around in the crowd He said, “Who touched my clothes?”
MAR 5:31 So His disciples said to Him, “You see the crowd pressing around you, yet you say, ‘Who touched me?’?”
MAR 5:32 But He kept looking around to see who had done it.
MAR 5:33 So the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell down before Him and told Him the whole truth.
MAR 5:34 And He said to her: “Daughter, your faith has saved you. Go into peace and be healed from your affliction.”
MAR 5:35 While He was still speaking, they came from the synagogue ruler's house saying: “Your daughter died. Why trouble the teacher further?”
MAR 5:36 But immediately upon hearing the spoken message Jesus said to the synagogue ruler, “Don't be afraid; just believe!”
MAR 5:37 He allowed no one to follow Him except Peter, James, and John, the brother of James.
MAR 5:38 Then He came to the synagogue ruler's house and found a commotion—weeping and loud wailing.
MAR 5:39 So upon entering He said to them: “Why are you making such a commotion and weeping? The child is not dead, but is asleep.”
MAR 5:40 But they started ridiculing Him. After He put them all out, He took the child's father and mother, and those with Him, and went in where the child was lying.
MAR 5:41 And taking the child by the hand He said to her, “Talitha koumi,” which is translated, “Little girl, I say to you, get up!”
MAR 5:42 Immediately the girl got up and started walking around (she was twelve years old). And they were overcome with great amazement.
MAR 5:43 He gave them strict orders that no one should know about it, and said to give her something to eat.
MAR 6:1 Then He went out from there and came to His hometown, and His disciples followed Him.
MAR 6:2 And when the Sabbath came He began to teach in the synagogue. And many who heard were astonished, saying: “Where did this man get these things? What wisdom is this that is given to him? Such mighty works are being performed by his hands!
MAR 6:3 Isn't this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James, Joses, Judas and Simon? And aren't his sisters here with us?” So they took offense at Him.
MAR 6:4 But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his hometown, among his relatives, even in his own house.”
MAR 6:5 He could do no mighty work there, except that He laid His hands on a few sick people and healed them.
MAR 6:6 And He marveled at their unbelief. Then He went about the villages in a circuit, teaching.
MAR 6:7 Then He summoned the twelve and began to send them out, two by two, giving them authority over the unclean spirits as He did so.
MAR 6:8 And He commanded them to take nothing for the road, except just a staff—no knapsack, no bread, no coin in the belt—
MAR 6:9 but to wear sandals, and not put on two tunics.
MAR 6:10 And He said to them: “Whenever you enter a house, stay there until you depart from that place.
MAR 6:11 And whoever will not receive you nor hear you, as you depart from there, shake off the dust that is under your feet as a testimony against them. Assuredly I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah on Judgment Day than for that city.”
MAR 6:12 So they went out and started preaching that people should repent,
MAR 6:13 and they were casting out many demons, and anointing with oil and healing many who were sick.
MAR 6:14 Now King Herod heard of Him, because His name had become well known, and he said, “John the Baptizer has been raised from the dead, and that is why the powers are at work in him.”
MAR 6:15 Others said, “He is Elijah.” Still others said, “He is a prophet like one of the prophets.”
MAR 6:16 But when Herod heard, he said: “This is John, whom I beheaded; he has been raised from the dead!”
MAR 6:17 You see, Herod himself had ordered John arrested, and bound him in prison, on account of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife; because he had married her
MAR 6:18 —John had kept saying to Herod, “It isn't lawful for you to have your brother's wife.”
MAR 6:19 So Herodias nursed a grudge against him and wanted to kill him; but she couldn't,
MAR 6:20 because Herod feared John and protected him, knowing him to be a just and holy man. And consulting him he would do many things; indeed, he would hear him with pleasure.
MAR 6:21 Then an opportune day came when on his birthday Herod gave a banquet for his courtiers, the military commanders, and the chief men of Galilee.
MAR 6:22 When the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced, and pleased Herod and those reclining with him, the king said to the girl, “Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you.”
MAR 6:23 He even swore to her, “Whatever you may ask me I will give you, up to half of my kingdom!”
MAR 6:24 So she went out and said to her mother, “What shall I ask?” And she said, “The head of John the Baptist!”
MAR 6:25 Hurrying in directly to the king she requested, saying, “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptist on a platter!”
MAR 6:26 Though the king became very sorry, because of his oaths and of his guests he did not want to refuse her.
MAR 6:27 Immediately the king sent an executioner and commanded the head to be brought. So he went and beheaded him in the prison,
MAR 6:28 brought the head on a platter, and gave it to the girl; and the girl gave it to her mother.
MAR 6:29 Upon hearing of it, his disciples came, removed the corpse and placed it in a tomb.
MAR 6:30 Then the apostles gathered to Jesus and reported all to Him, both what they had done and what they had taught.
MAR 6:31 Because so many were coming and going that they did not even have leisure to eat, He said to them, “Come aside by yourselves to a deserted place and rest awhile.”
MAR 6:32 So they went away in the boat by themselves to a deserted place.
