LUK 18:14 I say to you that this one went back home justified rather than that one; because everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
LUK 18:15 Then they even started bringing their babies to Him, that He might touch them; but when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
LUK 18:16 But Jesus summoned them and said: “Allow the little children to come to me, and do not hinder them; because the Kingdom of God is of such.
LUK 18:17 I tell you assuredly, whoever does not receive the Kingdom of God the way a little child does will by no means enter it.”
LUK 18:18 A certain ruler asked Him, saying, “Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
LUK 18:19 So Jesus said to him: “Why do you call me good? No one is good except one—God.
LUK 18:20 You know the commandments: ‘Do not commit adultery, do not murder, do not steal, do not give false testimony, honor your father and your mother.’ ”
LUK 18:21 And he said, “All these I have kept from my youth.”
LUK 18:22 Well upon hearing these things Jesus said to him, “You still lack one thing: sell all you have and distribute to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me.”
LUK 18:23 But when he heard this he became very sad, because he was extremely rich.
LUK 18:24 When Jesus saw that he became sad, He said: “How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter the Kingdom of God!
LUK 18:25 It is actually easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the Kingdom of God!”
LUK 18:26 So the hearers said, “Who then can be saved?”
LUK 18:27 And He said, “The things that are impossible with men are possible with God.”
LUK 18:28 Then Peter said, “Notice that we have left all and followed you!”
LUK 18:29 So He said to them, “Assuredly I say to you, there is no one who has left house or parents or brothers or wife or children, for the sake of the Kingdom of God,
LUK 18:30 who will not receive many times more in this present time, and in the age to come eternal life.”
LUK 18:31 Then He took the Twelve aside and said to them: “Take note, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of the Man will be fulfilled:
LUK 18:32 He will be betrayed to the Gentiles, and will be mocked and insulted and spit upon,
LUK 18:33 and they will scourge and kill Him. And on the third day He will rise again.”
LUK 18:34 But they understood none of these things; this saying was hidden from them, and they did not know what was being said.
LUK 18:35 Then it happened, as He approached Jericho, that a certain blind man was sitting alongside the road begging.
LUK 18:36 Hearing a crowd going by, he asked what it was.
LUK 18:37 So they told him that Jesus the Natsorean was passing by.
LUK 18:38 Well he shouted, saying, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
LUK 18:39 Those who led the way started reproving him, to shut him up; but he kept calling out all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
LUK 18:40 So Jesus stopped and ordered that he be brought to Him. When he got close He asked him, saying,
LUK 18:41 “What do you want me to do for you?” So he said, “Lord, that I may see again!”
LUK 18:42 Then Jesus said to him: “See again! Your faith has made you well.”
LUK 18:43 And immediately he did! and he followed Him, glorifying God. And all who witnessed it gave praise to God.
LUK 19:1 He entered and started passing through Jericho.
LUK 19:2 A man named Zacchaeus was there—he was a chief tax collector, and he was wealthy!
LUK 19:3 He was trying to see who Jesus was, but could not because of the crowd, because he was short.
LUK 19:4 And running on ahead he climbed up into a sycamore tree, in order to see Him, since He was about to pass by there.
LUK 19:5 And when Jesus came to the place, He looked up and saw him, and said to him, “Zacchaeus, come down quickly, because today I must stay at your house.”
LUK 19:6 So he came down quickly, and received Him joyfully.
LUK 19:7 But when they saw it, they all started complaining, saying, “He has entered to lodge with a sinful man!”
LUK 19:8 Then Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “Indeed, Lord, I herewith give half of my goods to the poor, and if I have extorted anything from anyone, I restore fourfold.”
LUK 19:9 So Jesus said about him, “Today salvation has happened in this house, in that he also is a son of Abraham;
LUK 19:10 because the Son of the Man has come to seek and to save that which was lost.”
LUK 19:11 Now as they heard these things, He continued with a parable, because He was near Jerusalem and they were supposing that the Kingdom of God was on the verge of being revealed.
LUK 19:12 So He said: “A certain nobleman went to a distant country to receive for himself a kingdom and return.
LUK 19:13 He called ten of his slaves, gave them ten ‘minas’, and said to them, ‘Conduct business until I come.’
LUK 19:14 But his citizens hated him and sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We do not want this man to reign over us.’
LUK 19:15 It happened that he did receive the kingdom, and upon returning he ordered that those slaves to whom he had given the money be called to him, to know who had gained what by trading.
LUK 19:16 So the first one came and said, ‘Master, your mina earned ten minas!’
LUK 19:17 He said to him: ‘Super, you good slave! Because you were faithful in a very little, have authority over ten cities!’
LUK 19:18 And the second one came and said, ‘Master, your mina made five minas.’
LUK 19:19 Likewise he said to him, ‘You also be over five cities.’
LUK 19:20 Then a different one came, saying: ‘Master, here is your mina, that I kept laid away in a piece of cloth
LUK 19:21 —I feared you because you are a hard man, removing what you did not place, and reaping what you did not sow.’
LUK 19:22 So he said to him: ‘I will judge you out of your own mouth, you wicked slave! You knew that I am a hard man, removing what I did not place, and reaping what I did not sow.
LUK 19:23 Why then didn't you put my money on deposit, and upon coming I would have collected it with interest?’
LUK 19:24 And to those standing by he said, ‘Take the mina from him and give it to him who has the ten minas.’
LUK 19:25 (They even said to him, ‘Master, he already has ten minas!’)
LUK 19:26 ‘Indeed I tell you, to everyone who has, more will be given; but from him who does not have, even what he has will be taken from him.
LUK 19:27 But as for those enemies of mine who did not want me to reign over them, bring them here and slaughter them in front of me!’ ”
LUK 19:28 Having said these things, He went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
LUK 19:29 When He drew near to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mountain called ‘of Olives’, it happened like this: He sent two of His disciples,
LUK 19:30 saying: “Go to the village opposite you, where as you enter you will find a colt tied, on which no man ever yet sat. Untie and bring it.
LUK 19:31 And if anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ just say this to him: ‘The Lord needs it.’ ”
LUK 19:32 So those who were sent went and found it just like He told them.
LUK 19:33 As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?”
LUK 19:34 So they said, “The Lord needs it.”
LUK 19:35 Then they brought it to Jesus; and throwing their own clothes on the colt, they placed Jesus on it.
LUK 19:36 And as He went along people were spreading their clothes on the road.
LUK 19:37 Then, as He was approaching the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works they had seen,
LUK 19:38 saying: “Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!”
LUK 19:39 Some of the Pharisees said to Him from the crowd, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”
LUK 19:40 In answer He said to them, “I tell you that if these should keep silent, the very stones would cry out!”
LUK 19:41 Now as He approached, observing the city He wept over it,
LUK 19:42 saying: “If you, yes you, especially in this your day, had known the things pertaining to your peace! But now they are hidden from your eyes.
LUK 19:43 Yes, the days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment around you; indeed they will surround you and hem you in on every side.
LUK 19:44 And they will raze you, and your children within you, to the ground—they will not leave in you one stone upon another—all because you did not recognize the time of your visitation.”
LUK 19:45 And upon entering the temple He began to drive out those who were selling and buying in it,
LUK 19:46 saying to them, “It is written: ‘My house is a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a ‘den of robbers’!”
LUK 19:47 And He was teaching daily in the temple; but the chief priests and the scribes, as also the leaders of the people, were trying to destroy Him,
LUK 19:48 but could not figure out how to do it, because all the people were hanging on His words.
LUK 20:1 Now it happened on one of those days, as He was teaching and evangelizing the people in the temple, that the priests and scribes came to Him with the elders
LUK 20:2 and addressed Him, saying, “Tell us by what authority you are doing these things; or who is he who gave you this authority?”
LUK 20:3 But in answer He said to them: “I also will ask you one thing; yes, tell me:
LUK 20:4 the baptism of John—was it from heaven or from men?”
LUK 20:5 So they reasoned among themselves, saying: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why did you not believe him?’
LUK 20:6 But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”
LUK 20:7 So they answered that they did not know where it was from.
LUK 20:8 And Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
LUK 20:9 Then He began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard, leased it to farmers, and went away on a long journey.
LUK 20:10 At the proper time he sent a slave to the farmers, that they might give him some of the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers flogged him and sent him away empty-handed.
LUK 20:11 Again he sent a different slave; so they flogged him also, treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty-handed.
LUK 20:12 And again he sent a third; but they wounded him also and threw him out.
LUK 20:13 Then the owner of the vineyard said: ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son; hopefully they will respect him when they see him.’
LUK 20:14 But when the farmers saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying: ‘This is the heir. Come, let's kill him, so that the inheritance may become ours.’
LUK 20:15 So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. What therefore will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
LUK 20:16 He will come and destroy those farmers and give the vineyard to others.” Having heard it they said, “May it never be!”
LUK 20:17 Then He looked directly at them and said: “What then is this that is written: ‘A stone that the builders rejected, the same became the cornerstone’?
LUK 20:18 Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces, but on whomever it should fall—it will crush him!”
LUK 20:19 The chief priests and the scribes wanted to lay hands on Him right then, but they were afraid —they knew He had spoken this parable against them.
LUK 20:20 Keeping a close watch on Him, they sent spies, who pretended to be innocent, so that they might latch on to something He said, so as to hand Him over to the power and the authority of the governor.
LUK 20:21 So they questioned Him, saying: “Teacher, we know that you speak and teach what is right, and you do not show favoritism but teach the way of God in truth.
LUK 20:22 Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”
LUK 20:23 But He perceived their craftiness and said to them: “Why are you testing me?
LUK 20:24 Show me a denarius—whose image and inscription does it have?” In answer they said, “Caesar's.”
LUK 20:25 So He said to them, “Then render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.”
LUK 20:26 They were unable to latch on to His word in front of the people; and marveling at His answer they kept silent.
LUK 20:27 Then some of the Sadducees, who deny that there is a resurrection, approached and questioned Him,
LUK 20:28 saying: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man's married brother dies childless, then his brother should take the widow and produce offspring for his brother.
LUK 20:29 Now there were seven brothers: the first took a wife and died childless;
LUK 20:30 then the second took the widow and he died childless;
LUK 20:31 then the third took her, in fact all seven in sequence—they all died childless.
LUK 20:32 Finally, last of all, the woman died also.
LUK 20:33 Therefore, in the resurrection, whose wife will she be, since all seven had her?”
LUK 20:34 So in answer Jesus said to them: “The people of this age marry and are given in marriage;
LUK 20:35 but those who are considered worthy to attain to that age, to the resurrection from among the dead, neither marry nor are given in marriage.
LUK 20:36 Because they cannot die anymore, being like angels—they are sons of God, being sons of the resurrection.
LUK 20:37 But that the dead are raised, Moses indeed revealed about the Bush when he recorded: ‘The Lord, the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.’
LUK 20:38 So He is not the God of the dead, but of the living—to Him all are alive.”
LUK 20:39 Then some of the scribes answered and said, “Teacher, you spoke well.”
LUK 20:40 And they no longer dared to question Him further.
LUK 20:41 Then He said to them: “How is it that they say that the Messiah is David's Son?
LUK 20:42 Why David himself affirms in the book of Psalms, ‘The Lord said to my Lord: sit at my right hand
LUK 20:43 until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.’
LUK 20:44 Since David calls Him ‘Lord’, how then is He his Son?”
LUK 20:45 Then, in the hearing of the people, He said to His disciples:
LUK 20:46 “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk around in long robes, and love greetings in the marketplaces, and the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts;
LUK 20:47 who ‘devour’ widows' houses, and for a show make long prayers. These will receive more severe judgment.”
LUK 21:1 Looking up He saw the rich putting their gifts into the treasure chest.
LUK 21:2 But He also saw a certain poor widow putting in two mites.
LUK 21:3 So He said: “I tell you truly that this poor widow put in more than all of them;
LUK 21:4 because all these others put in gifts for God out of their abundance, but she, out of her destitution, put in all she had to live on.”
LUK 21:5 Then, as some were admiring the temple, how it was adorned with beautiful stones and donations, He said,
LUK 21:6 “These things that you see—the days will come in which not one stone will be left upon another that will not be thrown down.”
LUK 21:7 So they asked Him, saying: “Teacher, so when will these things be?” and “What will be the sign when these things are about to happen?”
LUK 21:8 So He said: “Be careful, so as not to be deceived, because many will come in my name saying: ‘I am’ and ‘The time is at hand.’ Therefore do not go after them.
LUK 21:9 But whenever you hear of wars and insurrections, do not be terrified; because these things must happen first, but the end will not come right away.”
LUK 21:10 Then He said to them: “Nation will be raised up against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
LUK 21:11 And there will be severe earthquakes in various places, and famines and pestilences; and there will be fearful events and great signs from heaven.
LUK 21:12 But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and persecute you, delivering you up to synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors on account of my name.
LUK 21:13 But it will turn out for you as an occasion for testimony.
LUK 21:14 So settle it in your hearts not to practice giving a defense beforehand;
LUK 21:15 because I will give you a mouth and wisdom such that all your adversaries will not be able to contradict or withstand.
LUK 21:16 You will be betrayed even by parents and relatives, friends and ‘brothers’; and they will put some of you to death.
LUK 21:17 And you will be hated by all because of my name.
LUK 21:18 (Not even one hair of your head will be wasted
LUK 21:19 —you must secure your souls by your endurance.)
LUK 21:20 “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that her desolation is at hand.
LUK 21:21 Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains; let those who are in the city get out, and let those who are in the country not enter her.
LUK 21:22 Because these are days of vengeance, that all the written things may be fulfilled.
LUK 21:23 But woe to those who are pregnant and to those nursing babies in those days! There will be great distress in the land, and wrath to this people.
LUK 21:24 Yes, they will fall by the edge of the sword, and be led away captive into all nations. And Jerusalem will be trampled by Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
LUK 21:25 “There will be signs in sun, moon, and stars; and on the earth distress of nations, with perplexity, at the roaring and tossing of the sea;
LUK 21:26 men fainting from fear and expectation of the things coming on the inhabited earth—because the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
LUK 21:27 Then they will see the Son of the Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
LUK 21:28 Now when these things begin to happen, straighten up and lift up your heads, because your redemption is drawing near.”
LUK 21:29 Then He told them a parable: “Look at the fig tree and all the trees.
LUK 21:30 Whenever they are already budding, you see and know by yourselves that summer is now near.
LUK 21:31 So you also, whenever you see these things happening, know that the Kingdom of God is near.
LUK 21:32 I tell you assuredly, this generation will certainly not pass away until all has happened.
LUK 21:33 Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will by no means pass away.
LUK 21:34 “But keep a watch on yourselves, lest your hearts be weighed down with dissipation, drunkenness, and cares of life, and that Day come upon you suddenly.
LUK 21:35 Because it will come like a trap upon all those who dwell on the surface of the whole earth.
LUK 21:36 So be watchful all the time, praying that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that are about to happen and to stand before the Son of the Man.”
LUK 21:37 In the daytime He was teaching in the temple, but at night He went out and stayed on the mountain called ‘of Olives.’
LUK 21:38 Then early in the morning all the people would come to Him in the temple to hear Him.
LUK 22:1 Now the feast of unleavened bread, which is called ‘Passover’, drew near.
LUK 22:2 And the chief priests and the scribes were looking for a way to kill Him, because they feared the people.
LUK 22:3 Then Satan entered Judas (the one surnamed Iscariot), who was numbered among the Twelve.
LUK 22:4 So he went off and conferred with the chief priests and officers about how he might betray Him to them.
LUK 22:5 They were glad, and agreed to give him silver coins.
LUK 22:6 So he promised, and started looking for an opportunity to betray Him to them, without a crowd.
LUK 22:7 Then came the day of unleavened bread, in which it was necessary to kill the Passover lamb.
LUK 22:8 And He sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat.”
LUK 22:9 So they said to Him, “Where do you want us to prepare?”
LUK 22:10 He said to them: “Note, upon entering the city a man carrying a jar of water will meet you; follow him into the house which he enters.
LUK 22:11 Then you must say to the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you: Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?’
LUK 22:12 He himself will show you a large upper room, all furnished; make preparations there.”
LUK 22:13 So off they went and found things just as He had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.
LUK 22:14 When the hour had come, He reclined, and the twelve apostles with Him.
LUK 22:15 Then He said to them: “I have fervently desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.
LUK 22:16 I tell you further that I will not eat of it again until it is fulfilled in the Kingdom of God.”
LUK 22:17 And taking a cup He gave thanks and said: “Take this and share it among yourselves.
LUK 22:18 I tell you further that I will not drink again of the fruit of the vine until the Kingdom of God comes.”
LUK 22:19 Then, after the meal, He took bread, gave thanks, broke and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body which is given for you; do this in remembrance of me.”
LUK 22:20 He also took the cup, saying: “This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is shed for you.
LUK 22:21 “But alas, the hand of him who betrays me is with me on the table!
LUK 22:22 To be sure, the Son of the Man is going as it has been determined, but woe to that man by whom He is betrayed!”
LUK 22:23 (They began to question among themselves which of them it might be who was about to do this.)
LUK 22:24 Now there had actually been a discussion among them as to which of them seemed to be greater.
LUK 22:25 So He said to them: “The kings of the nations lord it over them, and those who exercise authority over them are called ‘benefactors’.
LUK 22:26 But not so with you—rather let the greater among you become as the younger, and he who leads as he who serves.
LUK 22:27 Who is greater, the one reclining or the one serving? Is it not the one reclining? Yet I am among you as the one who serves.
LUK 22:28 However, you are those who have continued with me in my trials.
LUK 22:29 And I bestow on you a kingdom, just as my Father bestowed one on me,
LUK 22:30 so that you may eat and drink at my table in my Kingdom; also you will sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel!”
LUK 22:31 Then the Lord said: “Simon, Simon! Indeed Satan has asked for you (pl) so as to sift you like wheat.
LUK 22:32 But I have prayed for you (sg) so that your faith not fail completely; so you, when you have recovered, strengthen your brothers.”
LUK 22:33 But he said to Him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”
LUK 22:34 So He said, “I say to you, Peter, no rooster can crow today before you deny three times that you know me!”
LUK 22:35 Then He said to them, “When I sent you without money bag, knapsack or sandals, did you lack anything?” And they said, “Nothing.”
LUK 22:36 So He said to them: “But now, he who has a money bag should take it, and likewise a knapsack; and he who has no sword must sell his garment and buy one.
LUK 22:37 Because I say to you that this which is written must still be fulfilled in me: ‘And he was classed with the lawless’; and because the things concerning me have an end.”
LUK 22:38 So they said, “Look, Lord, here are two swords.” And He said to them, “It is enough.”
LUK 22:39 Then going out He went to the Mount of Olives, as His custom was, and His disciples followed Him.
LUK 22:40 When He came to the place, He said to them, “Pray, so as not to enter into temptation.”
LUK 22:41 Then He withdrew from them about a stone's throw, knelt down and prayed,
LUK 22:42 saying, “Father, if you would just remove this cup from me—nevertheless, not my will, but yours, be done!”
LUK 22:43 Then an angel from heaven appeared to Him, strengthening Him.
LUK 22:44 And being in anguish He prayed with total concentration; then His sweat became like clots of blood, falling to the ground.
LUK 22:45 When He rose up from prayer and came to the disciples, He found them sleeping from sorrow.
LUK 22:46 He said to them: “Why do you sleep? Get up and pray, that you may not enter into temptation!”
LUK 22:47 But while He was still speaking—wow, a crowd; and he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them! He approached Jesus to kiss Him (he had given them this sign, “Whomever I kiss, it is he”).
LUK 22:48 So Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you betraying the Son of the Man with a kiss?”
LUK 22:49 When those who were around Him saw what was about to happen, they said to Him, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”
LUK 22:50 And a certain one of them struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear!
LUK 22:51 But Jesus reacted by saying, “Allow at least this!” and touching his ear He healed him.
LUK 22:52 Then Jesus said to the chief priests, officers of the temple, and elders who had come against Him: “Have you come out with swords and clubs as against a bandit?
LUK 22:53 When I was with you daily in the temple, you did not lay a hand on me. But this is your hour; even the authority of the darkness!”
LUK 22:54 Then they seized, took and brought Him to the house of the high priest, with Peter following at a distance.
LUK 22:55 Now when they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat among them.
LUK 22:56 Then a certain servant girl, seeing him sitting by the fire, looked intently at him and said, “This man also was with him.”
LUK 22:57 But he denied Him, saying, “Woman, I do not know him!”
LUK 22:58 After a little while another saw him and said, “You also are one of them.” But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
LUK 22:59 Then after about an hour had passed, another started insisting, “Surely this fellow also was with him, because he is a Galilean.”
LUK 22:60 But Peter said, “Man, I don't know what you're talking about!” And immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
LUK 22:61 And the Lord turned and looked directly at Peter; then Peter remembered the Lord's word, how He had said to him, “Before a rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”
LUK 22:62 And going outside he wept bitterly.
LUK 22:63 The men who were guarding Jesus started mocking and beating Him.
LUK 22:64 And having blindfolded Him they would hit His face and ask Him, saying: “Prophesy! Who was it who struck you?”
LUK 22:65 And they kept saying many other insulting things to Him.
LUK 22:66 As soon as it was day, the elders of the people, both the chief priests and scribes, came together and brought Him before their council, saying,
LUK 22:67 “If you are the Messiah, tell us.” But He said to them: “If I tell you, you simply will not believe.
LUK 22:68 But if I also question you, you will neither answer nor release me.
LUK 22:69 Hereafter the Son of the Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”
LUK 22:70 Then they all said, “Are you then the Son of God?” So He said to them, “You say it because I AM!”
LUK 22:71 Then they said: “What further testimony do we need? We ourselves have heard it from his mouth!”
LUK 23:1 Then the whole crowd of them rose up and led Him to Pilate.
LUK 23:2 And they began to accuse Him, saying, “We found this fellow perverting the nation and forbidding to pay taxes to Caesar, declaring himself to be Christ, a king.”
LUK 23:3 So Pilate questioned Him, saying, “Are you the king of the Jews?” In reply He said to him, “You said it!”
LUK 23:4 Then Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I find no guilt in this man.”
LUK 23:5 But they insisted, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee even to here.”
LUK 23:6 When Pilate heard ‘Galilee’, he asked if the man was a Galilean.
LUK 23:7 Upon learning that He belonged to Herod's jurisdiction, he sent Him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem during those days.
LUK 23:8 Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was really pleased, because for a long time he had been wanting to see Him, having heard so many things about Him; and he was hoping to see some miracle performed by Him.
LUK 23:9 He questioned Him with many words, but He gave him no answer.
LUK 23:10 On their part, the high priests and scribes stood by, vehemently accusing Him.
LUK 23:11 Then Herod and his soldiers, after ridiculing and mocking Him, arrayed Him in a gorgeous robe and sent Him back to Pilate.
LUK 23:12 (That very day Pilate and Herod became friends with each other—previously having been at odds with each other.)
LUK 23:13 Then Pilate, having called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
LUK 23:14 said to them: “You have brought this man to me as one who misleads the people, and yet, having examined him in your presence, I have found no guilt in this man as to those things of which you accuse him.
LUK 23:15 Further, neither did Herod (for I sent you on to him); indeed, nothing deserving of death has been done by him.
LUK 23:16 I will therefore flog and release him.”
LUK 23:17 (It was necessary for him to release one to them at the feast.)
LUK 23:18 But they all cried out together, saying: “Away with this one! Release to us Barabbas!”—
LUK 23:19 who had been thrown into prison for a certain insurrection in the city, and for murder.
LUK 23:20 Then Pilate, wanting to release Jesus, addressed them again.
LUK 23:21 But they just kept shouting: “Crucify! Crucify him!”
LUK 23:22 For the third time he said to them: “But what evil has this man done? I have found no reason for death in him. I will therefore flog and release him.”
LUK 23:23 But they were insistent, demanding with loud voices that He be crucified! And their voices, especially of the chief priests, prevailed.
LUK 23:24 So Pilate decided to grant their demand.
LUK 23:25 He released the one who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, the one they asked for; but he delivered Jesus to their will.
LUK 23:26 Now as they led Him away, they conscripted a certain Simon of Cyrene (coming in from a field), and put the cross on him to carry it behind Jesus.
LUK 23:27 A considerable crowd of people followed Him, including women who were also mourning and lamenting Him.
LUK 23:28 So Jesus turned to them and said: “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for me; rather weep for yourselves and for your children.
LUK 23:29 Because indeed, the days are coming in which they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, even the wombs that never bore and the breasts that never nursed!’
LUK 23:30 Then they will begin ‘to say to the mountains, “Fall on us!” and to the hills, “Cover us!” ’
LUK 23:31 For if they do these things in the ‘green tree’, what will happen in the ‘dry’?”
LUK 23:32 There were also two others, criminals, led with Him to be put to death.
LUK 23:33 When they arrived at the place called ‘The Skull’, they crucified Him there; also the criminals, one on His right, the other on His left.
LUK 23:34 Then Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing”; while they were dividing up His clothes by casting a lot.
LUK 23:35 Meanwhile the people stood looking on. And especially the rulers among them were sneering, saying, “He saved others; let him save himself, if such is the Christ, the chosen of God!”
LUK 23:36 Yes, even the soldiers mocked Him, approaching and offering Him sour wine,
LUK 23:37 and saying, “If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself!”
LUK 23:38 In fact, above Him there was a written notice, in Greek, Latin and Hebrew letters: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
LUK 23:39 Then one of the hanged criminals started berating Him, saying, “If you are the Christ, save yourself and us!”
LUK 23:40 But the other reacted and rebuked him, saying: “Don't you even fear God, since you are under the same condemnation?
LUK 23:41 And we indeed justly, for we are receiving the due reward for our deeds; but this man did nothing wrong.”
LUK 23:42 Then he said to Jesus, “Please remember me, Lord, when you come in your kingdom.”
LUK 23:43 Jesus said to him, “I tell you assuredly, today you will be with me in Paradise.”
LUK 23:44 Now it was about the sixth hour, and darkness came upon the whole land until the ninth hour.
LUK 23:45 Yes, the sun was darkened; also, the veil of the temple was torn in two.
LUK 23:46 Then, after giving a loud shout, Jesus said, “Father, it is into your hands that I will commit my spirit.” And having said this, He breathed out His spirit.
LUK 23:47 Well upon seeing what had happened, the centurion glorified God, saying, “Certainly this man was righteous!”
LUK 23:48 And the whole crowd that had gathered for the spectacle, when they saw what actually happened, went away beating their breasts.
LUK 23:49 But all His acquaintances, including the women who had followed Him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.
LUK 23:50 Now then, there was a man named Joseph, a good and righteous man, a Council member
LUK 23:51 (but he had not agreed with their counsel and action), from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, who himself was waiting for the Kingdom of God:
LUK 23:52 this man went to Pilate and asked for Jesus' body.
LUK 23:53 Then he took it down, wrapped it in linen, and placed it in a tomb cut out of rock, where no one had ever been laid.
LUK 23:54 It was a Preparation day; the Sabbath was drawing near.
LUK 23:55 The women who had come with Him from Galilee followed along, and they saw the tomb and how His body was placed there.
LUK 23:56 Then they returned and prepared spices and perfumes. But they rested on the Sabbath according to the commandment.
LUK 24:1 Then on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they went to the tomb carrying the spices they had prepared, along with some others.
LUK 24:2 They found the stone rolled away from the tomb,
LUK 24:3 but upon entering they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
LUK 24:4 And it happened, as they were greatly perplexed about this, that wow, two men stood by them in dazzling clothing!
LUK 24:5 Then, as they were afraid and bowed their faces to the ground, they said to them: “Why do you seek the living One among the dead?
LUK 24:6 He is not here, but is risen! Remember how He told you while still in Galilee,
LUK 24:7 saying, ‘The Son of the Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.’ ”
LUK 24:8 And they remembered His words.
LUK 24:9 Then they returned from the tomb and reported all these things to the Eleven, and to all the rest.
LUK 24:10 They were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the others with them, who told these things to the apostles.
LUK 24:11 But their words seemed to them like nonsense, and they disbelieved them.
LUK 24:12 (But Peter had gotten up and run to the tomb, and stooping down he saw the linen strips lying by themselves; and he departed, marveling to himself at what had happened.)
LUK 24:13 And then that same day two of them were going to a village called Emmaus, which was about seven miles from Jerusalem.
LUK 24:14 And they were conversing with each other about all that had happened.
LUK 24:15 And then, as they were conversing and discussing, Jesus Himself came up and started going with them.
LUK 24:16 But their eyes were restrained, in order that they not recognize Him.
LUK 24:17 So He said to them, “What words are these that you are exchanging with one another as you walk, and are gloomy?”
LUK 24:18 Then the one whose name was Cleopas answered and said to Him, “Are you the only one living in Jerusalem who doesn't know the things that have happened there in these days?”
LUK 24:19 He said to them, “What things?” So they said to Him: “The things concerning Jesus the Natsorean, how the man was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people,
LUK 24:20 and how the chief priests and our rulers handed him over to be condemned to death, and they crucified him.
LUK 24:21 And we were hoping that it was He who was going to redeem Israel! Further, besides all this, today is the third day since these things happened.
LUK 24:22 Moreover certain women of our group astonished us—arriving early at the tomb,
LUK 24:23 and not finding his body, they came saying that they had even seen a vision of angels, who said he was alive.
LUK 24:24 And certain of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said; but him they did not see.”
LUK 24:25 Then He said to them: “O foolish ones, and slow of heart to believe in all that the Prophets have spoken!
LUK 24:26 Was it really not necessary for the Christ to suffer these things, and to enter into His glory?”
LUK 24:27 And beginning from Moses, and then all the Prophets, He explained to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning Himself.
LUK 24:28 Then they approached the village where they were going, and He made as though He would keep going.
LUK 24:29 But they constrained Him, saying, “Stay with us, because it is toward evening, and the day is far spent.” So He went in to stay with them.
LUK 24:30 And then, as He was reclining with them, He took the bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them.
LUK 24:31 Then their eyes were opened and they recognized Him; and He became invisible to them.
LUK 24:32 They said to one another, “Were not our hearts burning within us while He talked to us on the road, and while He opened the Scriptures to us?”
LUK 24:33 So they got up forthwith and returned to Jerusalem, where they found the Eleven gathered together; also those with them,
LUK 24:34 who said, “The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”
LUK 24:35 Then they described what happened on the road, and how He was known to them in the breaking of the bread.
LUK 24:36 As they were saying these things, indeed, Jesus Himself stood in their midst, and He said to them, “Peace to you.”
LUK 24:37 But they, terrified, supposed they were seeing a ghost, and were becoming fearful.
LUK 24:38 And He said to them: “Why are you troubled?” and “Why do doubts arise in your hearts?
LUK 24:39 Look at my hands and feet; it is I myself! Feel me and see; a spirit does not have flesh and bones, as you see I have.”
LUK 24:40 And saying this He showed them His hands and His feet.
LUK 24:41 But as they were still disbelieving and marveling, because of the joy, He said to them, “Do you have any food here?”
LUK 24:42 So they gave Him a piece of broiled fish and some honeycomb.
LUK 24:43 And taking it He ate in their presence.
LUK 24:44 Then He said to them, “These are the words that I spoke to you while I was still with you, that everything that is written in the Law of Moses and the Prophets and the Psalms concerning me must be fulfilled.”
LUK 24:45 Then He opened their understanding so as to comprehend the Scriptures.
LUK 24:46 And He said to them: “Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day,
LUK 24:47 and that repentance and forgiveness of sins should be proclaimed in His name to all the nations, beginning from Jerusalem.
LUK 24:48 You are witnesses of these things.
LUK 24:49 Take note, I am sending the Promise of my Father upon you; but you must stay in the city of Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from on High.”
LUK 24:50 He led them out as far as Bethany, and lifting up His hands He blessed them.
LUK 24:51 And it happened, as He was blessing them, that He left them and was carried up into heaven.
LUK 24:52 Worshiping Him, they returned to Jerusalem with great joy;
LUK 24:53 and they were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
JOH 1:1 In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
JOH 1:2 He Himself existed in the beginning with God.
JOH 1:3 All things came to be by Him; that is, apart from Him not even one thing that has come into being came to be.
JOH 1:4 In Him was life, and the Life was the Light of mankind.
JOH 1:5 Now the Light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.
JOH 1:6 There was a man, sent from God, whose name was John.
JOH 1:7 This man came as a witness to testify about the Light, so that all might believe through him.
JOH 1:8 He himself was not the Light but was to testify about the Light—
JOH 1:9 the true Light which illumines everyone who comes into the world.
JOH 1:10 He was in the world, the world that came into being by Him, yet the world did not know Him.
JOH 1:11 He came to His own things, yet His own people did not receive Him.
JOH 1:12 But, as many as did receive Him, to them He gave the right to become children of God, to those who believe into His name:
JOH 1:13 who were begotten, not by blood, nor by the desire of the flesh, nor by the will of a man, but by God.
JOH 1:14 So the Word became flesh and lived among us, and we observed His glory, glory of an Only-begotten, from the Father, full of grace and truth.
JOH 1:15 John testified about Him and called out saying: “This is He of whom I said, ‘The One coming after me is now ahead of me, because He existed before I did.’ ”
JOH 1:16 Now we have all received from His fullness, yes, grace upon grace.
JOH 1:17 Because the Law was given through Moses; the Grace and the Truth came through Jesus Christ.
JOH 1:18 No one has ever seen God. The Only-begotten Son, who exists in the bosom of the Father, He has interpreted Him.
JOH 1:19 Now this is John's testimony, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
JOH 1:20 He confessed, he did not deny but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”
JOH 1:21 So they asked him, “What then, are you Elijah?” And he says, “I am not.” “Are you ‘the Prophet’?” “No,” he answered.
JOH 1:22 So they said to him: “Who are you?—so that we may give an answer to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
JOH 1:23 He said, “I am ‘the voice of one calling out: “Make the Lord's road straight in the wilderness,” ’ just as the prophet Isaiah said.”
JOH 1:24 Now those who had been sent were from the Pharisees.
JOH 1:25 So they asked him saying, “Why then do you baptize if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor ‘the Prophet’?”
JOH 1:26 John answered them saying: “I baptize with water, but among you stands One whom you do not know.
JOH 1:27 He is the One coming after me who is now ahead of me, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to loose.”
JOH 1:28 These things happened in Bithabara, across the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
JOH 1:29 The next day John sees Jesus coming toward him and says: “Look! The Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
JOH 1:30 This is He of whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who is now ahead of me, because He existed before I did.’
JOH 1:31 I did not know Him; but so that He should be revealed to Israel, that is why I came baptizing with water.”
JOH 1:32 And John testified saying: “I observed the Spirit coming down like a dove out of heaven, and He rested upon Him.
JOH 1:33 Now I did not know Him, but He who sent me to baptize with water, He said to me, ‘The One upon whom you see the Spirit coming down and resting—this is He who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
JOH 1:34 So I have seen and testified that this is the Son of God.”
JOH 1:35 Again the next day John was standing with two of his disciples.
JOH 1:36 And seeing Jesus walking by, he says, “Look, the Lamb of God!”
JOH 1:37 The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
JOH 1:38 So turning and observing them following Jesus says to them, “What do you want?” So they said to Him, “Rabbi” (which translated means ‘Teacher’), “where are You staying?”
JOH 1:39 He says to them, “Come and see.” So they went and saw where He was staying, and stayed with Him that day—it was about the tenth hour.
JOH 1:40 One of the two who heard John and followed Him was Andrew, Simon Peter's brother.
JOH 1:41 He first finds his own brother Simon and says to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which is translated ‘Christ’).
JOH 1:42 And he led him to Jesus. Looking at him Jesus said, “You are Simon, the son of Jonah; you will be called Cephas” (which is translated ‘Stone’).
JOH 1:43 The next day He decided to go to Galilee, so He finds Philip and says to him, “Follow me.”
JOH 1:44 (Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the hometown of Andrew and Peter.)
JOH 1:45 Philip finds Nathanael and says to him, “We have found the One of whom Moses in the Law—and also the prophets—wrote: Jesus the son of Joseph, from Natsareth.”
JOH 1:46 So Nathanael said to him, “Can anything good come out of Natsareth?” Philip says to him, “Come and see!”
JOH 1:47 Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward Him and says about him, “There, a genuine Israelite in whom there is no deceit!”
JOH 1:48 Nathanael says to Him, “From where do You know me?” Jesus answered and said to him, “Before Philip called you, while you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
JOH 1:49 In answer Nathanael says to Him: “Rabbi, You are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”
JOH 1:50 Jesus answered and said to him: “You believe because I said that I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater than these.”
JOH 1:51 And He says to him, “I tell you (pl) most assuredly, later on you will see the heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of the Man.”
JOH 2:1 On the third day a wedding took place in Cana of Galilee, and Jesus' mother was there.
JOH 2:2 Now both Jesus and His disciples had been invited to the wedding.
JOH 2:3 So when the wine had given out, Jesus' mother says to Him, “They don't have any wine!”
JOH 2:4 Jesus says to her: “What is that to you and me, woman? My time has not yet come.”
JOH 2:5 His mother says to the servants, “Do whatever He may tell you.”
JOH 2:6 (Now there were six stone waterpots set there, according to the purification rites of the Jews, containing 20 or 30 gallons each.)
JOH 2:7 Jesus says to them, “Fill the pots with water.” So they filled them to the brim.
JOH 2:8 So He says to them, “Now, draw some out and take it to the master of ceremonies.” So they took it.
JOH 2:9 Well, when the master of ceremonies tasted the water that had become wine—he did not know where it came from, but the servants who had drawn the water knew—he calls the bridegroom
JOH 2:10 and says to him: “Everybody serves the good wine first, then, when people are intoxicated, the inferior. You have kept the good wine until now!”
JOH 2:11 This, the first of the miraculous signs, Jesus performed in Cana of Galilee and revealed His glory; and His disciples believed into Him.
JOH 2:12 After this He went down to Capernaum—He, His mother, His brothers, and His disciples—but they did not stay there many days.
JOH 2:13 Now the Jewish Passover was near, so Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
JOH 2:14 And in the Temple He found people selling oxen and sheep and doves, also the moneychangers at work.
JOH 2:15 When He had made a scourge out of cords, He drove all out of the temple, both the sheep and the oxen; and as for the moneychangers, He overturned the tables and scattered the coins.
JOH 2:16 And to the dove-sellers He said: “Get these things out of here! Stop turning my Father's House into a marketplace!”
JOH 2:17 Then His disciples remembered that it stands written, “Zeal for Your House consumes me.”
JOH 2:18 So the Jews answered and said to Him, “What sign do you show us, since you do these things?”
JOH 2:19 Jesus answered and said to them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it.”
JOH 2:20 So the Jews said, “It took forty-six years to build this temple, and you will raise it in three days?!”
JOH 2:21 But He was speaking about the temple of His body.
JOH 2:22 Therefore, when He was raised from among the dead His disciples remembered that He had said this; so they believed the Scripture, even the word that Jesus had spoken.
JOH 2:23 Now while He was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed into His name, observing the signs that He was doing.
JOH 2:24 But as for Jesus Himself, He did not entrust Himself to them, because He knew all men
JOH 2:25 and that He had no need that anyone should testify about man, because He Himself knew what was in man.
JOH 3:1 Now there was a man among the Pharisees whose name was Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.
JOH 3:2 The same went to Jesus at night and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that you have come as a teacher from God, because no one can do these signs that you do unless God is with him.”
JOH 3:3 Jesus answered and said to him, “Most assuredly I say to you, unless someone is begotten from Above, he is not able to see the kingdom of God.”
JOH 3:4 Nicodemus says to Him: “How can a man be begotten, being old? He can't enter his mother's womb a second time and be born, can he?”
JOH 3:5 Jesus answered: “Most assuredly I say to you, unless someone is begotten by water and Spirit he is not able to enter the kingdom of God.
JOH 3:6 That which has been begotten by the flesh is flesh, and that which has been begotten by the Spirit is spirit.
JOH 3:7 Do not be perplexed that I said to you, ‘You (pl) need to be begotten from Above.’
JOH 3:8 The wind blows where it wishes, and you (sg) hear its sound, but you do not know where it comes from or where it goes. So it is with everyone who has been begotten by the Spirit.”
JOH 3:9 Nicodemus answered and said to Him, “How can these things be?”
JOH 3:10 Jesus answered and said to Him: “You are the teacher of Israel, yet you do not understand these things?
JOH 3:11 Most assuredly I say to you, we speak what we know and testify to what we have seen, but you (pl) do not receive our testimony.
JOH 3:12 If I have told you earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I should tell you the heavenly?
JOH 3:13 No one has gone up into Heaven except the One who came down out of Heaven —the Son of the Man, who is in Heaven.
JOH 3:14 Also, just as Moses lifted up the snake in the wilderness, just so the Son of the Man must be lifted up,
JOH 3:15 so that everyone who believes into Him should not be wasted, but should have eternal life.
JOH 3:16 Because God loved the world so much that He gave His only begotten Son, so that everyone who believes into Him should not be wasted, but should have eternal life.
JOH 3:17 For God did not send His Son into the world in order to condemn the world, but so that the world might be saved through Him.
JOH 3:18 The one believing into Him is not condemned, but the one not believing has already been condemned, because he has not believed into the name of the only begotten Son of God.
JOH 3:19 “Now this is the basis for the condemning, that the Light has come into the world, but the people loved the darkness rather than the Light, because their deeds were malignant.
JOH 3:20 For whoever practices evil hates the Light and does not come to the Light, so that his deeds may not be exposed.
JOH 3:21 But whoever does the truth comes to the Light so that his deeds may be clearly seen, that they are done in God.”
JOH 3:22 After these things Jesus, with His disciples, went into the Judean countryside, and there He spent time with them and baptized.
JOH 3:23 Now John also was baptizing in Aenon, near Salem, because there was plenty of water there. And people were coming and being baptized;
JOH 3:24 for John had not yet been thrown into prison.
JOH 3:25 Then some of John's disciples had an argument with a Judean about purification.
JOH 3:26 So they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, the One who was with you across the Jordan, about whom you have testified—well, here He is baptizing, and everyone is flocking to Him!”
JOH 3:27 John answered and said: “A person can receive nothing unless it has been given to him from Heaven.
JOH 3:28 You yourselves can testify that I said, ‘I am not the Christ, but I have been sent ahead of Him.’
JOH 3:29 He who has the bride is the bridegroom, but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands by and hears him, has great joy at the bridegroom's voice. So this my joy has been fulfilled.
JOH 3:30 He must increase, but I must decrease.
JOH 3:31 “He who comes from Above is above all; he who is from the earth is earthly, and speaks of the earth. He who comes from Heaven is above all.
JOH 3:32 And to what He has seen and heard He testifies, yet no one receives His testimony.
JOH 3:33 The one who receives His testimony certifies that God is true.
JOH 3:34 For He whom God sent speaks God's words, because God does not give the Spirit by measure.
JOH 3:35 The Father loves the Son and has given all things into His hand.
JOH 3:36 The one believing into the Son has eternal life, but the one disobeying the Son will not see the Life, but the wrath of God will remain upon him.”
JOH 4:1 Now when Jesus knew that the Pharisees had heard, “Jesus is making and baptizing more disciples than John”
JOH 4:2 (although Jesus Himself was not baptizing, but His disciples),
JOH 4:3 He left Judea and went away into Galilee.
JOH 4:4 Now He needed to go through Samaria;
JOH 4:5 so He comes to a city of Samaria called Sychar, near the plot of land that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
JOH 4:6 Now Jacob's well was there; so Jesus, being worn out from the journey, sat as He was by the well. It was about 6 p.m.
JOH 4:7 A woman of Samaria comes to draw water. Jesus says to her, “Give me a drink.”
JOH 4:8 (His disciples had gone into the town to buy food.)
JOH 4:9 So the Samaritan woman says to Him, “How can you, being a Jew, ask a drink from me, being a Samaritan woman?” (for Jews do not associate with Samaritans).
JOH 4:10 Jesus answered and said to her: “If you knew the gift of God, and who is the one saying to you, ‘Give me a drink,’ you would have asked him and he would have given you living water.”
JOH 4:11 The woman says to Him: “Sir, you don't even have a bucket, and the well is deep; so where do you get this living water?
JOH 4:12 You aren't greater than our father Jacob, are you? He gave us the well and drank from it himself, as did his sons and his livestock.”
JOH 4:13 Jesus answered and said to her: “Everyone who drinks of this water will thirst again,
JOH 4:14 but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never ever thirst; rather, the water that I will give him will become in him a spring of water, welling up into eternal life.”
JOH 4:15 The woman says to Him, “Sir, give me this water! so that I may not thirst, nor come here to draw.”
JOH 4:16 Jesus says to her, “Go, call your husband and come back here.”
JOH 4:17 The woman answered and said, “I don't have a husband.” Jesus says to her: “You stated correctly that you do not have a husband,
JOH 4:18 because you have had five husbands, and the one you have now is no husband of yours. You spoke the truth there!”
JOH 4:19 The woman says to Him: “Sir, I perceive that you are a prophet.
JOH 4:20 Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, while you (pl) say that the place where one must worship is in Jerusalem.”
JOH 4:21 Jesus says to her: “Woman, believe me, a time is coming when neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem will you worship the Father.
JOH 4:22 You [Samaritans] worship what you do not know; we [Jews] worship what we do know, because the salvation is from the Jews.
JOH 4:23 But the time is coming, in fact now is, when the genuine worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth. Really, because the Father is looking for such people to worship Him.
JOH 4:24 God is Spirit, and those who worship Him must worship in spirit and truth.”
JOH 4:25 The woman says to Him: “I know that Messiah is coming (who is called Christ). When He comes He will explain everything to us.”
JOH 4:26 Jesus says to her, “I am He, the one who is talking with you!”
JOH 4:27 At that point His disciples arrived, and they were amazed that He was talking with a woman; yet no one said, “What do you want?” or “Why are You talking with her?”
JOH 4:28 So the woman left her water jar, went her way into the town, and says to the men:
JOH 4:29 “Come see a man who told me everything I ever did! Could this be the Messiah?”
JOH 4:30 So out they went from the town and started toward Him.
JOH 4:31 Now in the meantime the disciples were urging Him saying, “Rabbi, eat.”
JOH 4:32 But He said to them, “I have food to eat that you do not know about.”
JOH 4:33 So the disciples started saying to one another, “Could someone have brought Him something to eat?”
JOH 4:34 Jesus says to them: “My food is to do the will of Him who sent me and to complete His work.
JOH 4:35 Do you not say, ‘There are four months before the harvest comes?’ Well I say, Look! Lift your eyes and observe the fields; they are white for harvest already!
JOH 4:36 Now he who reaps receives pay and gathers fruit into eternal life, so that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together.
JOH 4:37 Now the saying, ‘One is the sower and another the reaper,’ is true in this:
JOH 4:38 I sent you to reap that for which you have not labored; others have labored and you have entered into their labors.”
JOH 4:39 Now many of the Samaritans from that city believed into Him because of the word of the woman, testifying that “He told me everything I ever did!”
JOH 4:40 So when the Samaritans came to Him they urged Him to stay with them; and He did stay there two days.
JOH 4:41 Many more believed through His own word,
JOH 4:42 and they kept saying to the woman, “It is not just because of what you said that we believe, because we ourselves have heard Him, and we know that this One is truly the Messiah, the Savior of the world!”
JOH 4:43 So after the two days He departed from there and went on into Galilee.
JOH 4:44 (For Jesus Himself testified that a prophet does not have honor in his own country.)
JOH 4:45 So when He came into Galilee the Galileans welcomed Him, having seen all the things that He did in Jerusalem, at the festival; for they too had gone to the festival.
JOH 4:46 So Jesus went again to Cana of Galilee, where He made the water wine. Now there was a certain royal official whose son was sick in Capernaum.
JOH 4:47 When this man heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to Him and implored Him to come down and heal his son, for he was about to die.
JOH 4:48 So Jesus said to him, “Unless you people see signs and wonders you will not believe!”
JOH 4:49 The official says to Him, “Sir, come down before my child dies!”
JOH 4:50 Jesus says to him, “Go; your son lives.” Well the man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and off he went.
JOH 4:51 Now while he was still going down his slaves met him and reported saying, “Your son lives!”
JOH 4:52 So he inquired of them the hour in which he got better. And they said to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”
JOH 4:53 So the father knew that it was at the exact hour in which Jesus told him, “Your son lives.” Both he himself and his whole household believed.
JOH 4:54 Again, coming out of Judea into Galilee, Jesus performed this second miraculous sign.
JOH 5:1 After these things there was the feast of the Jews, so Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
JOH 5:2 Now in Jerusalem, by the Sheep Gate, there is a pool called Bethesda, in Hebrew, which has five porches.
JOH 5:3 In them a large number of sick people were lying—blind, lame, paralyzed—waiting for the moving of the water;
JOH 5:4 because an angel would go down from time to time into the pool and stir up the water—then the first one to get in after the stirring of the water became well of whatever disease that was holding him.
JOH 5:5 Now there was a certain man there who had been sick for 38 years.
JOH 5:6 Seeing this man lying there and knowing that he had already been sick a long time, Jesus says to him, “Do you want to get well?”
JOH 5:7 The sick man answered Him, “Sir, I have no man to throw me into the pool when the water is stirred up, but while I am coming another gets in before me.”
JOH 5:8 Jesus says to him, “Get up, pick up your pallet and walk!”
JOH 5:9 Immediately the man became well and picked up his pallet and started to walk!
JOH 5:10 But that day was a Sabbath, so the Jews said to the one who had been healed: “It's the Sabbath! You aren't allowed to carry the pallet.”
JOH 5:11 He answered them: “The one who made me well—He said to me, ‘Pick up your pallet and walk.’ ”
JOH 5:12 So they asked him, “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Pick up your pallet and walk’?”
JOH 5:13 But the man who was cured did not know who it was, because Jesus had disappeared, there being a crowd in the place.
JOH 5:14 After these things Jesus found him in the temple and said to him: “See, you are well. Don't sin any more, so that something worse doesn't happen to you.”
JOH 5:15 The man went off and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
JOH 5:16 So because of this the Jews began persecuting Jesus and trying to kill Him, because He was doing these things on the Sabbath.
JOH 5:17 But Jesus answered them, “Until now, my Father works, I also work.”
JOH 5:18 So because of this they wanted to kill Him all the more, because He was not only breaking the Sabbath but was even saying that God was His own Father, making Himself equal with God!
JOH 5:19 Then Jesus answered and said to them: “Most assuredly I say to you, the Son is not able to do anything from Himself, except something He sees the Father doing; because whatever things He does, precisely these the Son also does.
JOH 5:20 For the Father loves the Son and shows Him everything that He Himself is doing; and He will show Him greater works than these, so that you may marvel.
JOH 5:21 Now just as the Father raises the dead and gives life, just so the Son also gives life to whom He wishes.
JOH 5:22 In fact the Father does not judge anyone but has committed all the judging to the Son,
JOH 5:23 so that all will honor the Son just as they honor the Father. Whoever does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent Him.
JOH 5:24 “Most assuredly I say to you that the one listening to my word and believing on Him who sent me has eternal life; he will not go into judging but has moved out of the death into the Life.
JOH 5:25 “Most assuredly I say to you that a time is coming, and now is, when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of the God, and those who listen will live.
JOH 5:26 Because just as the Father has life in Himself, just so He gave to the Son also to have life in Himself;
JOH 5:27 furthermore He gave Him the authority to pass judgment, because He is Son of Man.
JOH 5:28 Do not marvel at this, because a time is coming in which all those in the graves will hear His voice
JOH 5:29 and will come out—those who did good things into the resurrection of life, but those who practiced evil things into the resurrection of condemnation.
JOH 5:30 I am not able to do anything from myself. As I hear, I judge, and my judging is just, because I do not seek my own will but the will of the Father who sent me.
JOH 5:31 “If I testify about myself, my testimony is not valid.
JOH 5:32 There is another who testifies about me, and I know that the testimony that He gives about me is true.
JOH 5:33 You have sent to John and he has testified to the truth.
JOH 5:34 Yet I do not accept the testimony from a man; but I say these things so that you may be saved.
JOH 5:35 That man was a burning, shining lamp, and for a time you were willing to be glad in his light.
JOH 5:36 But I have a greater testimony than John's, because the works that the Father gave me to complete—the very works that I am doing—they testify about me that the Father has sent me.
JOH 5:37 “Further, the Father who sent me has Himself testified about me. You have neither heard His voice nor seen His form at any time.
JOH 5:38 Nor do you have His word abiding in you, because you do not believe on the very one whom He sent.
JOH 5:39 You examine the Scriptures because in them you think you have eternal life, yet they are the very ones that testify about me.
JOH 5:40 But you are not willing to come to me so that you may have life.
JOH 5:41 “I do not accept glory from people.
JOH 5:42 Rather I have come to know you, that you do not have the love of God in you.
JOH 5:43 I have come in my Father's name and you do not receive me; should another come in his own name, him you will receive.
JOH 5:44 How can you believe, who receive glory from men and do not seek the glory that comes from the only God?
JOH 5:45 “Do not suppose that I will accuse you before the Father. Moses is the one who accuses you, on whom you have set your hope.
JOH 5:46 Because if you really believed Moses you would believe me, because he wrote about me.
JOH 5:47 But since you do not believe his writings, how will you believe my sayings?”
JOH 6:1 After these things Jesus went over the Sea of Galilee, or Tiberias.
JOH 6:2 And a huge crowd was following Him because they had seen His signs that He kept performing on the sick.
JOH 6:3 So Jesus went up on the mountain and sat down there with His disciples.
JOH 6:4 (Now the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was near.)
JOH 6:5 Then, raising His eyes and observing that a huge crowd was coming toward Him, Jesus says to Philip, “Where shall we buy bread so that these folks may eat?”
JOH 6:6 Now He said this to test him, for He Himself knew what He was about to do.
JOH 6:7 Philip answered Him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread would not be enough for them, so that each of them could receive a little.”
JOH 6:8 One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, says to Him,
JOH 6:9 “There is a little boy here who has five loaves of barley bread and two small fish, but what are they for so many?”
JOH 6:10 Then Jesus said, “Make the people recline.” Now there was plenty of grass in the place; so the men reclined, about five thousand in number.
JOH 6:11 Then Jesus took the loaves, and having given thanks He distributed them to the disciples, and the disciples to those who were reclining; so too with the fish, as much as they wanted.
JOH 6:12 So when they were full He says to His disciples, “Collect the leftover fragments so that nothing be wasted.”
JOH 6:13 So they collected and filled twelve baskets with fragments from the five barley loaves that were left over from those who had eaten.
JOH 6:14 Now then, having seen the miraculous sign that Jesus performed the men said, “This One really is the Prophet who is to come into the world.”
JOH 6:15 So Jesus, perceiving that they were about to come and take Him by force to make Him king, withdrew up the mountain again by Himself, alone.
JOH 6:16 Now as evening came on His disciples had gone down to the sea,
JOH 6:17 and getting into the boat they started to go across the sea toward Capernaum. Well it had been dark for a while and Jesus had not come to them.
JOH 6:18 Further, the sea was being agitated by a strong wind blowing.
JOH 6:19 Then, after they had rowed some three or four miles, they see Jesus walking on the sea and coming near the boat; and they were afraid.
JOH 6:20 But He said to them, “It is I; don't be afraid!”
JOH 6:21 Then they wanted to receive Him into the boat, and immediately the boat was at the land to which they were going.
JOH 6:22 The next day the crowd that had stayed on the other side of the sea, having seen that there was no other boat there except the one into which His disciples had entered, and that Jesus had not gotten into the boat with His disciples but only His disciples had gone away—
JOH 6:23 although other boats had come from Tiberias, near the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks—
JOH 6:24 so when the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor His disciples were there, they got into the boats and went to Capernaum, looking for Jesus.
JOH 6:25 When they found Him on another side of the sea they said to Him, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”
JOH 6:26 Jesus answered them and said: “Most assuredly I say to you, you are not seeking me because you saw miraculous signs, but because you ate the bread and were filled.
JOH 6:27 Do not work for the food that wastes away but for the food that endures into life eternal, which the Son of the Man will give you; because on Him God the Father has set His seal.”
JOH 6:28 So they said to Him, “What should we do so that we may work the works of God?”
JOH 6:29 Jesus answered and said to them, “This is the work of God, that you believe into the One whom He sent.”
JOH 6:30 So they said to Him: “Well then, what sign are you going to do so we may see and believe you? What are you going to perform?
JOH 6:31 Our fathers ate the manna in the desert, just as it is written: ‘He gave them bread from Heaven to eat.’ ”
JOH 6:32 Then Jesus said to them: “Most assuredly I say to you, Moses did not give you the bread from Heaven, but my Father gives you the true bread from Heaven.
JOH 6:33 For the bread of God is the One coming down out of Heaven and giving Life to the world.”
JOH 6:34 Then they said to Him, “Lord, give us this bread always.”
JOH 6:35 So Jesus said to them: “I am the bread of the Life. Whoever comes to me will never hunger, and whoever believes into me will never thirst.
JOH 6:36 But, as I told you, you have actually seen me, yet you do not believe.
JOH 6:37 All that the Father gives me will come to me, and the one who comes to me I will not throw out;
JOH 6:38 because it is not to do my own will that I have come down out of Heaven, but the will of the One who sent me.
JOH 6:39 Now this is the will of the Father who sent me, that I should lose nothing out of all that He has given me, but should raise it up at the last day.
JOH 6:40 Again this is the will of Him who sent me, that everyone who ‘sees’ the Son and believes into Him may have eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.”
JOH 6:41 Then the Jews started complaining about Him, because He said, “I am the bread that came down out of Heaven.”
JOH 6:42 And they were saying: “Isn't this Jesus the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? So how can he say, ‘I have come down out of Heaven’?”
JOH 6:43 So Jesus answered and said to them: “Stop complaining among yourselves.
JOH 6:44 No one is able to come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him, and I will raise him up at the last day.
JOH 6:45 It is written in the prophets, ‘And they will all be taught by God.’ Therefore everyone who listens and learns from the Father comes to me.
JOH 6:46 (Not that anyone has seen the Father, except the One who is from God—He has seen the Father.)
JOH 6:47 Most assuredly I say to you: the one believing into me has eternal life.
JOH 6:48 “I am the bread of the Life.
JOH 6:49 Your fathers ate manna in the desert, and they died.
JOH 6:50 This is the bread that comes down out of Heaven, so that anyone may eat of it and not die.
JOH 6:51 I am the living bread which came down out of Heaven. If anyone eats of this bread he will live forever. Actually, the bread that I will give is my flesh, which I will give on behalf of the life of the world.”
JOH 6:52 At that the Jews started quarrelling among themselves, saying, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?!”
JOH 6:53 So Jesus said to them: “Most assuredly I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of the Man and drink His blood, you do not have Life within yourselves.
JOH 6:54 Whoever chews my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.
JOH 6:55 Really, my flesh is genuine food and my blood is genuine drink.
JOH 6:56 Whoever chews my flesh and drinks my blood abides in me and I in him.
JOH 6:57 Just as the living Father sent me and I live because of the Father, so also the one who feeds on me will live because of me.
JOH 6:58 This is the bread that came down out of Heaven. Whoever feeds on this bread of mine will live forever (in contrast to your fathers who ate the manna and died).”
JOH 6:59 He said these things while teaching in a synagogue in Capernaum.
JOH 6:60 Therefore, upon hearing this many from among His disciples said: “This word is hard! Who is able to hear it?”
JOH 6:61 So Jesus, knowing in Himself that His disciples were complaining about this, said to them: “Does this offend you?
JOH 6:62 What if you should see the Son of the Man going up to where He was at first?
JOH 6:63 The Spirit is the One who makes alive; the flesh does not benefit anything. The words that I speak to you are spirit, are Life.
JOH 6:64 But there are some among you who do not believe.” (For Jesus knew from the start who they were who did not believe, and who was betraying Him.)
JOH 6:65 And He said, “That is why I told you that no one can come to me unless it has been granted to him by my Father.”
JOH 6:66 From that time many of His disciples turned back and stopped going around with Him.
JOH 6:67 So Jesus said to the twelve, “You don't want to go away too, do you?”
JOH 6:68 So Simon Peter answered Him: “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.
JOH 6:69 Further, we have come to believe and to know that you are the Christ, the Son of the Living God!”
JOH 6:70 He said to them: “Did I myself not choose you twelve? Yet one of you is a devil.”
JOH 6:71 He was referring to Judas Iscariot, son of Simon, for it was he who would betray Him, being one of the twelve.
JOH 7:1 After these things Jesus continued to move about in Galilee, since He did not wish to move about in Judea because the Jews were wanting to kill Him.
JOH 7:2 Now the Jews' Feast of Tabernacles was near.
JOH 7:3 So His brothers said to Him: “Leave here and go up into Judea so your disciples also may see the works that you are doing,
JOH 7:4 because no one does anything in secret while he actually wants to be in evidence. Since you are doing these things, show yourself to the world!”
JOH 7:5 For not even His brothers were believing into Him.
JOH 7:6 So Jesus says to them: “My time is not here yet, but your time is always available.
JOH 7:7 The world cannot hate you, but does hate me, because I testify about it that its works are malignant.
JOH 7:8 You guys go up to this feast; I am not going up yet to this feast, because my time has not yet fully come.”
JOH 7:9 So upon saying these things to them He stayed on in Galilee.
JOH 7:10 Now when His brothers had gone up to the feast, then He too went up, not openly but in secret like.
JOH 7:11 So the Jews were looking for Him at the feast and saying, “Where is he?”
JOH 7:12 And there was a lot of murmuring about Him among the crowds. Some were saying, “He is good”; others were saying, “On the contrary, he's deceiving the people.”
JOH 7:13 However, no one was talking openly about Him for fear of the Jews.
JOH 7:14 Now when the feast was already half over Jesus went up into the temple and started to teach.
JOH 7:15 And the Jews were marveling saying, “How is this man learned, not having been educated?”
JOH 7:16 So Jesus answered them and said: “What I teach is not mine, but His who sent me.
JOH 7:17 If anyone wants to do His will, he will know concerning the teaching, whether it is from God or whether I am speaking on my own.
JOH 7:18 Someone who speaks on his own is seeking his own glory; but He who seeks the glory of the One who sent Him, He is true, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.
JOH 7:19 “Did not Moses give you the Law? And yet not one of you keeps the Law! Why do you want to kill me?”
JOH 7:20 The crowd answered and said, “You must have a demon! Who wants to kill you?”
JOH 7:21 Jesus answered and said to them: “I did one work, and you all marvel.
JOH 7:22 Consider this: Moses gave you circumcision (not that it comes from Moses, but from the patriarchs), and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath.
JOH 7:23 If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath, so that the Law of Moses won't be broken, are you angry at me because I made a whole man well on the Sabbath?
JOH 7:24 Stop judging on the basis of appearances, but judge the righteous judgment.”
JOH 7:25 Now some of the Jerusalemites were saying: “Isn't this the man they are wanting to kill?
JOH 7:26 Yet look! He is speaking openly and they are saying nothing to Him. Could it be true that the rulers know that this is really the Christ?
JOH 7:27 On the other hand, we know where this man is from; but whenever the Christ comes nobody knows where He is from.”
JOH 7:28 So Jesus called out in the temple, teaching and saying: “You do know me, and you know where I am from. Yet I have not come on my own, but the One who sent me is true, whom you do not know.
JOH 7:29 I do know Him because I am from Him, and He sent me.”
JOH 7:30 So they tried to arrest Him, yet no one laid a hand on Him because His hour had not yet come.
JOH 7:31 Now many of the crowd were believing into Him, and they were saying, “Whenever the Christ comes He won't perform more signs than these which this man has done, will He?”
JOH 7:32 The Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring these things about Him, so the Pharisees and the chief priests sent operatives to arrest Him.
JOH 7:33 Then Jesus said: “For a little while I am still with you, and then I go to the One who sent me.
JOH 7:34 You will look for me and not find me; also, where I am you cannot come.”
JOH 7:35 So the Jews said among themselves: “Where does this fellow intend to go that we won't find him? He doesn't intend to go to the Dispersion among the Greeks and teach the Greeks, does he?
JOH 7:36 What word is this that he spoke, ‘You will look for me and not find me’; also, ‘where I am you cannot come’?”
JOH 7:37 Now on the last and most important day of the Feast, Jesus stood up and called out saying: “If anyone thirsts, let him come to me and drink.
JOH 7:38 The one believing into me, just as the Scripture has said, out from his innermost being will flow rivers of living water.”
JOH 7:39 (Now He said this about the Spirit, whom those believing into Him were going to receive, in that the Holy Spirit had not yet been given because Jesus had not yet been glorified.)
JOH 7:40 So upon hearing this word many from the crowd began to say, “This One really is ‘the Prophet’!”
JOH 7:41 Others were saying, “This One is the Christ!” Others were saying: “Surely the Christ isn't coming out of Galilee, is He?
JOH 7:42 Doesn't the Scripture say that the Christ comes out of the seed of David and from the town of Bethlehem, where David was?”
JOH 7:43 So there developed a division in the crowd because of Him.
JOH 7:44 Further, some of them were wanting to arrest Him, but no one laid a hand on Him.
JOH 7:45 Then the operatives came to the chief priests and Pharisees, who said to them, “Why haven't you brought him?”
JOH 7:46 The operatives answered, “No man ever spoke like this man!”
JOH 7:47 So the Pharisees answered them: “You haven't been fooled too, have you?
JOH 7:48 None of the rulers or the Pharisees have believed into him, have they?
JOH 7:49 But this crowd that doesn't know the law is accursed!”
JOH 7:50 Nicodemus (the one who came to Him at night, being one of them) says to them,
JOH 7:51 “Our law doesn't judge a man before it hears him and knows what he is doing, does it?”
JOH 7:52 They answered and said to him: “You aren't from Galilee too, are you? Search and see that no prophet has ever arisen out of Galilee.”
JOH 7:53 So each one went to his own house.
JOH 8:1 Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
JOH 8:2 And at dawn He went again into the temple, and all the people were coming to Him; so sitting down He started to teach them.
JOH 8:3 Then the scribes and the Pharisees bring to Him a woman caught in adultery; and placing her in the center
JOH 8:4 they say to Him: “Teacher, we found this woman committing adultery, in the very act.
JOH 8:5 Now in our law Moses commanded that such women are to be stoned; so what do you say?”
JOH 8:6 They said this to test Him, so that they might have an accusation against Him. But stooping down Jesus began to write on the ground with His finger, taking no notice.
JOH 8:7 But since they kept on asking Him, straightening up He said to them, “Let the one without sin among you throw the first stone at her.”
JOH 8:8 And stooping down again He continued writing on the ground.
JOH 8:9 Now upon hearing this, and being convicted by their conscience, they began to go out one by one, starting with the older ones down to the least. So only Jesus was left, with the woman in the center.
