JOH 8:10 So straightening up, and not seeing anyone except the woman, Jesus said to her: “Where are those accusers of yours? Has no one condemned you?”
JOH 8:11 So she said, “No one, Lord.” Jesus said to her: “Neither do I condemn you. Go, and from now on don't sin any more!”
JOH 8:12 Then Jesus spoke to them again, saying: “I am the Light of the world. Whoever follows me will not walk around in the darkness, but will have the light of the Life.”
JOH 8:13 So the Pharisees said to Him, “You are testifying about yourself; your testimony is not valid.”
JOH 8:14 Jesus answered and said to them: “Even though I testify about myself, my testimony is valid, because I know where I came from and where I am going. But you do not know where I come from or where I am going.
JOH 8:15 You are judging according to the flesh; I am not judging anyone.
JOH 8:16 Yet even if I do judge, my judging is valid, in that I am not alone in judging, but I and the Father who sent me are together.
JOH 8:17 It is written precisely in your law that the testimony of two men is valid:
JOH 8:18 I am one testifying concerning myself and the Father who sent me testifies concerning me.”
JOH 8:19 Then they said to Him, “Where is your father?” Jesus answered: “You know neither me nor my Father. If you knew me you would also know my Father.”
JOH 8:20 Jesus spoke these words in the treasury, while teaching in the temple; yet no one arrested Him, because His time had not yet come.
JOH 8:21 Then Jesus said to them again: “I am going away, and you will look for me, and you will die in your sin. Where I am going you cannot come.”
JOH 8:22 So the Jews said, “He won't kill himself, will he, since he says, ‘Where I am going you cannot come’?”
JOH 8:23 He said to them: “You are from below; I am from Above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.
JOH 8:24 That is why I told you that you will die in your sins, because if you do not believe that I am, you will die in your sins.”
JOH 8:25 So they said to Him, “Who are you?” And Jesus said to them: “Just what I have been saying to you from the beginning.
JOH 8:26 I have many things to say and to judge about you, but He who sent me is true, and what I myself have heard from Him—these things I say to the world.”
JOH 8:27 They did not understand that He was speaking to them about the Father.
JOH 8:28 Then Jesus said to them: “When you lift up the Son of the Man, then you will know that I am and that I do nothing from myself; but just as my Father has taught me, these things I speak.
JOH 8:29 And the One who sent me is with me. The Father has not left me alone, because I always do the things that please Him.”
JOH 8:30 While He was saying these things many believed into Him.
JOH 8:31 So Jesus said to those Jews who had believed Him: “If you abide in my word, you really are my disciples;
JOH 8:32 and you will know the Truth, and the Truth will make you free.”
JOH 8:33 They answered and said to Him: “We are descendants of Abraham and have never been enslaved to anyone. How can you say, ‘You will be made free’?”
JOH 8:34 Jesus answered them: “I tell you most assuredly that everyone committing sin is a slave of sin.
JOH 8:35 Now the slave does not remain in the household forever; the son does remain forever.
JOH 8:36 Therefore, if the Son should make you free, you really will be free.
JOH 8:37 I know that you are descendants of Abraham, but you are wanting to kill me because my word finds no place in you.
JOH 8:38 On my part, I speak what I have observed with my Father, while on your part you do what you have observed with your father.”
JOH 8:39 They answered and said to Him, “Our father is Abraham!” Jesus says to them: “If you were children of Abraham, you would do the works of Abraham;
JOH 8:40 but now you are wanting to kill me, a man who has told you the truth which I heard from God. This sort of thing Abraham did not do!
JOH 8:41 You do the works of your father.” Then they said to Him, “We were not born of fornication; we have one Father—God.”
JOH 8:42 So Jesus said to them: “If God were your Father, you would love me, because I came forth from God and I am here. Further, I have not come on my own, but He sent me.
JOH 8:43 Why don't you understand what I say?—because you are not able to really hear my word.
JOH 8:44 You are of your father the devil, and it is the desires of your father that you want to do. He was a murderer from the beginning and has not stood in the truth, because there is no truth in him. Whenever he speaks the lie he speaks from his own things, because he is a liar and the father of lying.
JOH 8:45 But since I speak the truth you do not believe me.
JOH 8:46 Which of you convicts me of sin? So if I speak the truth, why do you not believe me?
JOH 8:47 The one who is of God hears God's words; that is why you do not hear, because you are not of God.”
JOH 8:48 So the Jews answered and said to Him, “We say that you are a Samaritan and have a demon—are we wrong?”
JOH 8:49 Jesus answered: “I do not have a demon; rather, I honor my Father, while you dishonor me.
JOH 8:50 Yet I do not seek my glory; there is One who seeks and judges.
JOH 8:51 Most assuredly I say to you, if anyone should keep my word he will never ever see death.”
JOH 8:52 So the Jews said to Him: “Now we know that you have a demon! Abraham died and so did the prophets; yet you say, ‘If anyone should keep my word he will never ever taste death’!
JOH 8:53 Surely you aren't greater than our father Abraham, who died? And the prophets are dead. Who do you make yourself out to be?”
JOH 8:54 Jesus answered: “If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing. It is my Father who glorifies me, of whom you say, ‘He is our God.’
JOH 8:55 Yet you have not known Him, but I do know Him. And if I should say that I do not know Him I would be a liar just like you (pl); but I do know Him and I keep His word.
JOH 8:56 Your father Abraham was overjoyed to see my day; yes, he saw it and rejoiced.”
JOH 8:57 So the Jews said to Him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and you have seen Abraham?!”
JOH 8:58 Jesus said to them, “Most assuredly I say to you, before Abraham came to be, I AM!”
JOH 8:59 Then they picked up stones to throw at Him; but Jesus was concealed and went out of the temple, going through the middle of them; yes, that is how He got away!
JOH 9:1 Now as He was passing by He saw a man blind from birth.
JOH 9:2 And His disciples asked Him saying, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, in that he was born blind?”
JOH 9:3 Jesus answered: “Neither this man nor his parents sinned, but so that the works of God might be displayed in him.
JOH 9:4 I must accomplish the works of Him who sent me while it is day; night is coming when no one can work.
JOH 9:5 While I am in the world, I am the Light of the world.”
JOH 9:6 Upon saying these things He spat on the ground and made mud with the saliva, and spread the mud on the blind man's eyes.
JOH 9:7 And He said to him, “Go wash in the pool of Siloam” (which is translated, ‘Sent’). So he went and washed, and came away seeing!
JOH 9:8 Then the neighbors and those who previously had seen that he was blind started saying, “Isn't this the man who sat begging?”
JOH 9:9 Others said, “This is he”; still others, “He is like him.” He kept saying, “I'm the one!”
JOH 9:10 So they said to him, “How were your eyes opened?”
JOH 9:11 He answered and said: “A man called Jesus made mud and anointed my eyes and said to me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam and wash.’ So when I went and washed, I saw!”
JOH 9:12 Then they said to him, “Where is He?” He says, “I don't know.”
JOH 9:13 They bring the man who was formerly blind to the Pharisees.
JOH 9:14 (Now it was a Sabbath when Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes.)
JOH 9:15 So once again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. So he said to them, “He put mud on my eyes, and I washed, and I see.”
JOH 9:16 Then some of the Pharisees said, “This man cannot be from God, because he does not keep the Sabbath,” Others were saying, “How can a sinful man do such signs?” And there was a division among them.
JOH 9:17 So they address the blind man again, “What do you say about him, in that he opened your eyes?” He said, “He is a prophet.”
JOH 9:18 However the Jews did not believe concerning him that he was blind and received sight until they summoned the parents of the one who had received sight.
JOH 9:19 And they asked them saying: “Is this your son, whom you say was born blind? How then does he now see?”
JOH 9:20 So his parents answered them and said: “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind;
JOH 9:21 but by what means he now sees we don't know, or who opened his eyes we don't know. He is of age. Ask him. He will speak for himself.”
JOH 9:22 His parents said these things because they feared the Jews, because the Jews had already agreed that if anyone confessed Him to be Christ he would be barred from the synagogue.
JOH 9:23 That is why his parents said, “He is of age; ask him.”
JOH 9:24 So they summoned the man who had been blind a second time and said to him: “Give glory to God! We know that this man is a sinner.”
JOH 9:25 So he answered and said: “That He is a sinner, I do not know. One thing I do know, that having been blind I now see!”
JOH 9:26 So they said to him again: “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?”
JOH 9:27 He answered them: “I already told you and you didn't listen. Why do you want to hear it again? You don't want to become His disciples too, do you?”
JOH 9:28 They reviled him and said: “You are that fellow's disciple, but we are Moses' disciples.
JOH 9:29 We know that God spoke to Moses; but this fellow—we don't know where he's from.”
JOH 9:30 The man answered and said to them: “Why, this is remarkable—you don't know where He is from; yet He opened my eyes!
JOH 9:31 Now we know that God doesn't listen to sinners; but if anyone is God-fearing and does His will, to him He listens.
JOH 9:32 Since time began it was never heard that anyone opened the eyes of a person born blind.
JOH 9:33 If this man were not from God he would not be able to do anything.”
JOH 9:34 They answered and said to him, “You were totally born in sins, and you are teaching us?” And they expelled him.
JOH 9:35 Jesus heard that they had expelled him, and finding him He said to him, “Do you believe into the Son of God?”
JOH 9:36 He answered and said, “And who is He, Lord, that I may believe into Him?”
JOH 9:37 So Jesus said to him, “You have both seen Him and He is the One who is speaking with you.”
JOH 9:38 So he said, “Lord, I believe!” And he worshiped Him.
JOH 9:39 And Jesus said, “I came into this world for judgment, so that those who do not see may see, and those who ‘see’ may become blind.”
JOH 9:40 And some of the Pharisees who were with Him heard these words and said to Him, “We aren't blind too, are we?”
JOH 9:41 Jesus said to them: “If you were ‘blind’ you would not have sin. But now you say, ‘We see,’ so your sin remains.
JOH 10:1 “Most assuredly I say to you, he who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.
JOH 10:2 But he who enters by the door is a shepherd of the sheep.
JOH 10:3 To him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice; and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
JOH 10:4 And whenever he takes out his own sheep he goes ahead of them, and the sheep follow him because they know his voice.
JOH 10:5 But they will not follow a stranger; rather they will run away from him, because they do not know the voice of strangers.”
JOH 10:6 Jesus gave them this illustration, but they did not understand what He was telling them.
JOH 10:7 Then Jesus addressed them again: “Most assuredly I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.
JOH 10:8 All who ever came before me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not listen to them.
JOH 10:9 I am the door. If anyone enters by me, he will be saved, and will go in and out and find pasture.
JOH 10:10 The thief comes only in order to steal, and to kill, and to destroy. I have come so that they may have life, and have it abundantly.
JOH 10:11 “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life on behalf of the sheep.
JOH 10:12 But the hired man, not being the shepherd and not owning the sheep, sees the wolf coming and abandons the sheep, and runs away; and the wolf snatches the sheep and scatters them.
JOH 10:13 Now the hired man runs away because he is a hired man and it does not matter to him about the sheep.
JOH 10:14 “I am the good shepherd, and I know my own sheep, and I am known by them.
JOH 10:15 Just as the Father knows me, I also know the Father, and I lay down my life on behalf of the sheep.
JOH 10:16 I also have other sheep, that are not of this fold; I must bring them also, and they will listen to my voice; and there will be one flock, one shepherd.
JOH 10:17 “Because of this the Father loves me, in that I lay down my life so that I may take it up again.
JOH 10:18 No one takes it from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have authority to lay it down, and I have authority to take it up again. This command I have received from my Father.”
JOH 10:19 Therefore there was another division among the Jews because of these words.
JOH 10:20 Many of them were saying: “He has a demon and is raving mad. Why do you listen to him?”
JOH 10:21 Others were saying: “These are not the sayings of someone who is demonized. A demon cannot open blind people's eyes, can it?”
JOH 10:22 Now it was the Feast of Dedication in Jerusalem; and it was winter.
JOH 10:23 And Jesus was walking about in the temple, in Solomon's porch.
JOH 10:24 Then the Jews surrounded Him and said to Him: “How long will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”
JOH 10:25 Jesus answered them: “I did tell you, and you do not believe. The works that I do in my Father's name—these testify concerning me.
JOH 10:26 But you do not believe because you are not among my sheep, just like I told you.
JOH 10:27 My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.
JOH 10:28 And I give them eternal life, and they will never ever be wasted; and no one will snatch them out of my hand.
JOH 10:29 My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all; and no one is able to snatch out of my Father's hand.
JOH 10:30 I and the Father are one.”
JOH 10:31 Therefore the Jews picked up stones again to stone Him.
JOH 10:32 Jesus answered them: “Many good works I have shown you from my Father. For which one of them are you stoning me?”
JOH 10:33 The Jews answered Him saying, “It is not for a good work that we are stoning you, but for blasphemy; precisely because you, being a man, make yourself God!”
JOH 10:34 Jesus answered them: “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said, you are gods’?
JOH 10:35 If He called them ‘gods’ to whom the Word of God came—and the Scripture cannot be broken—
JOH 10:36 do you say ‘You are blaspheming’ to the One the Father sanctified and sent into the world because I said, ‘I am God's Son’?
JOH 10:37 If I am not doing the works of my Father, do not believe me.
JOH 10:38 But if I am doing them, even though you do not believe me, believe the works, so that you may know and believe that the Father is in me, and I in Him.”
JOH 10:39 So they tried again to seize Him, but He escaped from their hand.
JOH 10:40 He went away again across the Jordan, to the place where John was baptizing at first; and He remained there.
JOH 10:41 And many came to Him and said, “Though John did not perform any sign, everything John said about this man was true.”
JOH 10:42 And many of the people there believed into Him.
JOH 11:1 Now a certain man, Lazarus of Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha, was sick.
JOH 11:2 (It was the Mary who [later] anointed the Lord with myrrh and wiped His feet with her hair whose brother Lazarus was sick.)
JOH 11:3 So the sisters sent to Him saying, “Lord, please, the one you love is sick!”
JOH 11:4 Upon hearing it Jesus said, “This sickness is not unto death but for the glory of God, so that the Son of God may be glorified through it.”
JOH 11:5 (Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.)
JOH 11:6 So, when He heard that he was sick He stayed where He was two more days!
JOH 11:7 Then after this He says to the disciples, “Let us go into Judea again.”
JOH 11:8 The disciples say to Him, “Rabbi, the Jews were just now trying to stone you, and you are going back there?”
JOH 11:9 Jesus answered: “Are there not twelve hours in the day? If anyone walks during the day he doesn't stumble, because he sees the light of this world.
JOH 11:10 But if anyone walks in the night he does stumble, because the light is not in him.”
JOH 11:11 Having said these things He says to them, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep, but I am going in order to awaken him.”
JOH 11:12 His disciples said to Him, “Lord, if he is sleeping he will get well.”
JOH 11:13 But Jesus had spoken of his death, while they thought He was talking about natural sleep.
JOH 11:14 So then Jesus said to them plainly: “Lazarus died.
JOH 11:15 And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, so that you may believe. But let us go to him.”
JOH 11:16 Then Thomas (called Twin) said to his fellow disciples, “Let's us go too, so that we may die with Him.”
JOH 11:17 So when Jesus had come, He found that he had already been in the tomb four days.
JOH 11:18 (Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about two miles away,
JOH 11:19 and many of the Jews had joined the women around Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.)
JOH 11:20 Then Martha, when she heard that Jesus was coming, went to meet Him; but Mary remained sitting at home.
JOH 11:21 Then Martha said to Jesus: “Lord, if You had been here my brother would not have died.
JOH 11:22 But even now I know that whatever You ask of God, God will give You.”
JOH 11:23 Jesus says to her, “Your brother will rise again.”
JOH 11:24 Martha says to Him, “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day.”
JOH 11:25 Jesus said to her: “I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes into me, though he may die, will live;
JOH 11:26 and everyone who both lives and believes into me will never ever die. Do you believe this?”
JOH 11:27 She says to Him, “Yes, Lord, I have come to believe that You are the Messiah, the Son of God, the One coming into the world.”
JOH 11:28 Having said these things she went and called her sister Mary, saying privately, “The Teacher is here and is calling you!”
JOH 11:29 Upon hearing it she gets up quickly and goes to Him.
JOH 11:30 (Now Jesus had not yet entered the village, but was in the place where Martha met Him.
JOH 11:31 Then the Jews who were with her in the house, consoling her, when they saw Mary get up quickly and go out, they followed her saying, “She is going to the tomb to weep there.”)
JOH 11:32 Then, when Mary came where Jesus was, upon seeing Him she fell at His feet, saying to Him, “Lord, if You had been here my brother would not have died!”
JOH 11:33 So when Jesus saw her crying, and the Jews who had come with her crying, He groaned in the spirit and was troubled.
JOH 11:34 And He said, “Where have you put him?” They say to Him, “Lord, come and see.”
JOH 11:35 Jesus wept.
JOH 11:36 So the Jews said, “See how he loved him!”
JOH 11:37 But some of them said, “Couldn't this man, who opened the eyes of the blind, have also kept this one from dying?”
JOH 11:38 Then, groaning within Himself again, Jesus arrived at the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone was lying against it.
JOH 11:39 Jesus says, “Remove the stone!” Martha, the sister of the deceased, says to Him, “Lord, he already stinks; it's been four days!”
JOH 11:40 Jesus says to her, “Did I not say to you that if you believe you will see the glory of God?”
JOH 11:41 Then they took away the stone from where the deceased was lying. Jesus raised His eyes and said: “Father, I thank You that You heard me.
JOH 11:42 I know that You always hear me, but I spoke for the sake of the crowd standing around, so that they may believe that You sent me.”
JOH 11:43 Upon saying these things He shouted with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
JOH 11:44 And out the deceased came! Bound hand and foot with bandages, and his face wrapped in a cloth. Jesus says to them, “Loose him and let him go.”
JOH 11:45 So many of the Jews who had come to Mary, and had seen what Jesus did, believed into Him.
JOH 11:46 But some of them went off to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.
JOH 11:47 Then the chief priests and the Pharisees convened a council and said: “What can we do? Because this man performs many miraculous signs;
JOH 11:48 if we let him go on like this everybody will believe into him; and the Romans will come and take away both our place and our nation!”
JOH 11:49 But one of them, Caiaphas, being high priest that year, said to them: “You know nothing at all!
JOH 11:50 Nor do you consider that it is advantageous for us that one man should die on behalf of the people, rather than the whole nation perish!”
JOH 11:51 (Now he did not say this on his own, but being high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus was about to die on behalf of the nation;
JOH 11:52 and not only on behalf of the nation, but also to gather into one all the scattered children of God.)
JOH 11:53 So from that day on they really plotted to kill Him.
JOH 11:54 Therefore Jesus no longer moved about openly among the Jews, but went away from there into the country near the wilderness, to a town called Ephraim; and He stayed there with His disciples.
JOH 11:55 Now the Jewish Passover was near, and many from the country went up to Jerusalem before the Passover in order to purify themselves.
JOH 11:56 So they were looking for Jesus, and as they stood in the temple they were saying to each other, “What do you think—that he won't come to the feast at all?”
JOH 11:57 Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had together issued an edict that if anyone knew where He was he should report it, so they could arrest Him.
JOH 12:1 Then, six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was (the deceased whom He raised from the dead).
JOH 12:2 So they gave a dinner for Him there—Martha was serving, while Lazarus was one of those reclining at the table with Him.
JOH 12:3 Then Mary, bringing a pound of pure oil of nard, very costly, anointed Jesus' feet, and wiped His feet with her hair! And the house was filled with the fragrance of the oil.
JOH 12:4 Then one of His disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon's son (who was about to betray Him), said,
JOH 12:5 “Why wasn't this oil sold for 300 denarii and given to the poor?”
JOH 12:6 (Now he did not say this because the poor mattered to him, but because he was a thief and had the money box; and used to pilfer what was put in it.)
JOH 12:7 So Jesus said: “Let her be; she has performed this with a view to my burial.
JOH 12:8 For you always have the poor with you, but you do not always have me.”
JOH 12:9 Then a large crowd of the Jews learned that He was there; and they came, not only because of Jesus but also to see Lazarus, whom He had raised from the dead.
JOH 12:10 So the chief priests decided to kill Lazarus as well,
JOH 12:11 in that because of him many of the Jews were defecting and believing into Jesus.
JOH 12:12 The next day a large crowd that had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming into Jerusalem,
JOH 12:13 took branches from palm trees and went out to meet Him. And they started shouting: “Hosanna!” “Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!” “King of Israel!”
JOH 12:14 And finding a young donkey Jesus sat on it; just as it is written:
JOH 12:15 “Fear no more, daughter of Zion. Look, your King is coming, sitting on a donkey's colt!”
JOH 12:16 (Now His disciples did not understand these things at first; but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about Him, and they had done them to Him.)
JOH 12:17 So the crowd that had been with Him when He called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead continued to testify.
JOH 12:18 That is also why the crowd met Him, because they heard that He had performed this sign.
JOH 12:19 So the Pharisees said among themselves: “You can see that you are not making any difference! Just look, the world has gone off after Him!”
JOH 12:20 Now there were some Greeks among those who went up to worship at the feast.
JOH 12:21 So these men approached Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, and requested of him saying, “Sir, we want to see Jesus.”
JOH 12:22 Philip goes and tells Andrew, and in turn Andrew and Philip tell Jesus.
JOH 12:23 But Jesus answered them saying: “The hour has come for the Son of the Man to be glorified.
JOH 12:24 Most assuredly I say to you, if a grain of wheat, having fallen into the ground, does not die, it remains alone; but if it dies it bears a lot of fruit.
JOH 12:25 The one ‘loving’ his life will waste it, and the one ‘hating’ his life, in this world, will preserve it into eternal life.
JOH 12:26 If anyone would serve me, let him follow me; and where I am, my servant will be too. Further, if anyone serves me, the Father will honor him.
JOH 12:27 “Now my soul is distressed, and what should I say—‘Father, rescue me from this hour’? But this is why I came to this hour—
JOH 12:28 ‘Father, glorify your name!’ ” Then a Voice came out of Heaven, “I have both glorified it and will glorify it again!”
JOH 12:29 So the crowd that was standing by and listening said that it had thundered. Others said, “An angel has spoken to Him.”
JOH 12:30 Jesus answered and said: “It was not for my sake that this Voice came, but for your sakes.
JOH 12:31 Now is the judgment of this world; now the ruler of this world will be thrown out.
JOH 12:32 While I, if I be lifted up from the earth, I will draw all people to myself.”
JOH 12:33 (Now He said this to indicate by what kind of death He was about to die.)
JOH 12:34 The people answered Him: “We have heard from the Law that the Messiah remains forever; and so how can you say, ‘The Son of the Man must be lifted up’? Who is this ‘the Son of the Man’?”
JOH 12:35 Then Jesus said to them: “The Light will be with you just a little longer. Walk while you have the light, so that darkness does not overtake you; the one who walks in the darkness does not know where he is going.
JOH 12:36 While you have the Light, believe into the Light, so that you may become sons of light.” Jesus said these things, and going away He was hidden from them.
JOH 12:37 Although He had performed so many signs in their presence, they were not believing into Him;
JOH 12:38 so that the word spoken by Isaiah the prophet should be fulfilled: “Lord, who has believed what we heard? And to whom has the arm of the Lord really been revealed?”
JOH 12:39 Therefore they were unable to believe, in that Isaiah said again:
JOH 12:40 “He has blinded their eyes and hardened their hearts, lest they should see with their eyes and understand with their hearts and should turn around, and I would heal them.”
JOH 12:41 Isaiah said these things when he saw His glory and spoke concerning Him.
JOH 12:42 Nevertheless, even among the rulers many believed into Him, but because of the Pharisees they did not confess Him, so they would not be expelled from the synagogue;
JOH 12:43 for they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
JOH 12:44 Jesus called out and said: “The one believing into me believes not into me but into Him who sent me.
JOH 12:45 And the one seeing me sees Him who sent me.
JOH 12:46 I, Light, have come into the world so that everyone who believes into me will not remain in the darkness.
JOH 12:47 Also, if someone hears my words and does not believe, I do not judge him; because I did not come to judge the world but to save the world.
JOH 12:48 The one who rejects me and does not receive my sayings has that which judges him—the word that I have spoken, that is what will judge him on the last day;
JOH 12:49 because I have not spoken on my own, but the Father who sent me, He gave me a command, what I should say and what I should speak.
JOH 12:50 And I know that His command is eternal life. So whatever I say, I say it just like the Father told me.”
JOH 13:1 Now before the Feast of the Passover, Jesus, knowing that His hour had come that He should depart from this world to the Father, having loved His own who were in the world He loved them to the end.
JOH 13:2 And after supper (the devil already having put it into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to betray Him),
JOH 13:3 Jesus, knowing that the Father had given everything into His hands, and that He had come from God and was going to God,
JOH 13:4 He gets up from the meal and lays aside His garments, and taking a towel He tied it around Himself.
JOH 13:5 Then He poured water into the basin and began to wash the disciples' feet and to dry them with the towel with which He was wrapped.
JOH 13:6 So He comes to Simon Peter, and he says to Him, “Lord, you wash my feet?!”
JOH 13:7 Jesus answered and said to him, “What I am doing you do not understand now, but you will know [by experience] after this.”
JOH 13:8 Peter says to Him, “You will never ever wash my feet!!” Jesus answered him, “If I do not wash you, you have no part with me.”
JOH 13:9 Simon Peter says to Him, “Lord, not only my feet, but also my hands and my head!”
JOH 13:10 Jesus says to him: “One who is bathed has no need except to wash his feet, but is clean all over. And you (pl) are clean, but not all of you.”
JOH 13:11 (He knew who was betraying Him; that is why He said, “Not all of you are clean.”)
JOH 13:12 So when Jesus had washed their feet and put His garments back on, He reclined again and said to them: “Do you know what I have done to you?
JOH 13:13 You address me as ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord’, and you speak correctly, because I am.
JOH 13:14 So then, if I, Lord and Teacher, washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another's feet.
JOH 13:15 Because I have given you an example, so that you also should do just as I did to you.
JOH 13:16 “Most assuredly I say to you, a slave is not greater than his owner, neither is a messenger greater than the one who sent him.
JOH 13:17 If you understand these things, you are blessed if you do them.
JOH 13:18 “I do not speak concerning all of you—I know whom I chose. But let the Scripture be fulfilled: ‘The one eating bread with me lifted up his heel against me.’
JOH 13:19 I am telling you now before it happens, so that when it does happen you will believe that I am.
JOH 13:20 Most assuredly I say to you, he who receives whomever I send receives me, and he who receives me receives Him who sent me.”
JOH 13:21 Having said these things, Jesus was distressed in His spirit and testified saying, “Most assuredly I say to you, one of you will betray me!”
JOH 13:22 So the disciples started looking at each other, at a loss as to whom He meant.
JOH 13:23 Now one of His disciples, whom Jesus loved, was reclining beside Jesus' bosom.
JOH 13:24 So Simon Peter motions to him to inquire whom it might be that He was referring to.
JOH 13:25 And leaning back against Jesus' breast he says to Him, “Lord, who is it?”
JOH 13:26 Jesus answers, “It is the one to whom I will give the piece of dunked bread.” And dunking the bread He gives it to Judas Iscariot, Simon's son.
JOH 13:27 And after the sop, then Satan entered into him. Whereupon Jesus says to him, “What you are doing, do quickly!”
JOH 13:28 (Now none of those reclining at the table knew why He said this to him.
JOH 13:29 Since Judas had the money box, some supposed that Jesus was telling him to buy what they needed for the feast, or to give something to the poor.)
JOH 13:30 So having received the sop, immediately he went out. And it was night.
JOH 13:31 When he had gone out Jesus says: “Now the Son of the Man has been glorified, and God has been glorified in Him.
JOH 13:32 Since God has been glorified in Him, God will also glorify Him with Himself, and He will do so presently.
JOH 13:33 “Little children, I am with you just a little longer. You will look for me, and as I said to the Jews, ‘Where I am going you cannot come,’ so now I say to you.
JOH 13:34 “I give you a new commandment, that you love one another just as I have loved you—that you also love one another.
JOH 13:35 By this all will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.”
JOH 13:36 Simon Peter says to Him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus answered him, “Where I am going you cannot follow me now, but later you will follow me.”
JOH 13:37 Peter says to Him: “Lord, why can't I follow you now? I will lay down my life for your sake!”
JOH 13:38 Jesus answered him: “You will lay down your life for my sake? Most assuredly I say to you, no rooster can crow until you have denied me three times!
JOH 14:1 “Do not let your (pl) heart be distressed; you believe into God and you believe into me.
JOH 14:2 In my Father's house are many dwellings (otherwise I would have told you). I am going away to prepare a place for you.
JOH 14:3 And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and take you to myself, so that where I am you may be also.
JOH 14:4 Now you know where I am going, and you know the way.”
JOH 14:5 Thomas says to Him, “Lord, we don't know where you are going, so how can we know the way?”
JOH 14:6 Jesus says to him: “I am the Way and the Truth and the Life. No one goes to the Father except through me.
JOH 14:7 If you had known me, you would have known my Father as well; from now on you both know Him and have seen Him.”
JOH 14:8 Philip says to Him, “Lord, show us the Father, and it is enough for us.”
JOH 14:9 Jesus says to him: “Such a long time I have been with you, and you have not known me, Philip? He who has seen me has seen the Father; so how can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
JOH 14:10 Don't you believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words that I speak to you I do not speak on my own; rather it is the Father who dwells in me who does the works.
JOH 14:11 Believe me that I am in the Father and the Father is in me; or else, believe me because of the works themselves.
JOH 14:12 “Most assuredly I say to you, the one believing into me, he too will do the works that I do; in fact he will do greater works than these, because I am going to my Father.
JOH 14:13 Further, whatever you (pl) may ask in my name, that I will do, so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
JOH 14:14 If you ask anything in my name, I will do it!
JOH 14:15 If you love me, keep my commandments.
JOH 14:16 Also, I will ask the Father and He will give you another Enabler, so that He may stay with you throughout the age
JOH 14:17 —the Spirit of the Truth, whom the world is unable to receive, because it neither sees Him nor knows Him; but you do know Him, because He is staying with you and will be in you.
JOH 14:18 “I will not leave you orphans; I will come to you [shortly].
JOH 14:19 In a little while the world will no longer see me, but you will see me. Because I live you also will live.
JOH 14:20 In that day you will know that I am in my Father, and you in me, and I in you.
JOH 14:21 The one who has my commandments and keeps them, he is the one who loves me. Now the one who loves me will be loved by my Father; and I will love him, and reveal myself to him.”
JOH 14:22 Judas (not the Iscariot) says to Him, “Lord, just how is it that You are going to reveal Yourself to us and not to the world?”
JOH 14:23 Jesus answered and said to him: “If anyone loves me he will keep my word. So my Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our home with him.
JOH 14:24 The one who does not love me does not keep my words; further, the word which you hear is not mine but the Father's who sent me.
JOH 14:25 “I have spoken these things to you while being with you.
JOH 14:26 But the Enabler, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, He will teach you all things and remind you of everything I said to you.
JOH 14:27 “Peace I leave with you, my peace I give to you; it is not like the world gives that I give to you. Do not let your heart be distressed or intimidated.
JOH 14:28 “You heard me say to you, ‘I am going away and I am coming back to you.’ If you loved me you would have been glad that I said, ‘I am going to the Father,’ because my Father is greater than I.
JOH 14:29 I have told you now, before it happens, so that when it does happen you may believe.
JOH 14:30 “I will no longer talk much with you, because the ruler of the world is approaching; actually, he has nothing in me.
JOH 14:31 Rather, I habitually do just as the Father commanded me, so that the world may know that I love the Father. “Get up, let us leave here.
JOH 15:1 “I am the vine, the true one, and my Father is the vinedresser.
JOH 15:2 Any branch in me which does not produce fruit He lifts up, and every one producing fruit He prunes, so that it may produce more fruit.
JOH 15:3 You are already clean because of the word that I have spoken to you.
JOH 15:4 Abide in me and I in you. Just as a branch is incapable of producing fruit by itself, except it remains in the vine, so neither can you unless you abide in me.
JOH 15:5 “I am the vine, and you are the branches. The one who abides in me and I in him, he is the one who produces much fruit, because apart from me you are incapable of doing anything.
JOH 15:6 If anyone does not abide in me he is thrown out, like a branch, and dries up; well they gather such and throw them into the fire, and he is burned up.
JOH 15:7 If you abide in me and my sayings abide in you, you will ask whatever you desire and it will happen for you.
JOH 15:8 My Father is glorified by this: that you produce much fruit; and you will become disciples to me.
JOH 15:9 “Just as the Father has loved me, I also have loved you; abide in my love.
JOH 15:10 If you keep my commandments, you will abide in my love, just as I have kept my Father's commandments and abide in His love.
JOH 15:11 I have spoken these things to you so that my joy may remain in you, and that your joy may be made full.
JOH 15:12 This is my commandment, that you love one another just as I have loved you.
JOH 15:13 No one has greater love than this, that someone should lay down his life for his friends.
JOH 15:14 You are my friends if you do whatever I command you.
JOH 15:15 “I no longer call you slaves, because a slave does not know what his owner is doing; rather I have called you friends, because I have made known to you everything that I heard from my Father.
JOH 15:16 It was not you who chose me but I who chose you, and I appointed you so that you should go and produce fruit, and that your fruit should endure, so that whatever you may ask the Father in my name He may give you.
JOH 15:17 These things I command you so that you love one another.
JOH 15:18 “When the world hates you, you can be sure that it has hated me first.
JOH 15:19 If you were of the world, the world would be fond of its own. So because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, that is why the world hates you.
JOH 15:20 Remember the word that I said to you, ‘A slave is not greater than his owner.’ If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they kept my word, they will also keep yours.
JOH 15:21 Now they will do all of these things to you because of my name, in that they do not know the One who sent me.
JOH 15:22 If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be having sin, but now they have no excuse for their sin.
JOH 15:23 The one who hates me hates my Father too.
JOH 15:24 If I had not done among them the works that no one else has done, they would not be having sin; but now they have both seen and hated both me and my Father.
JOH 15:25 However, this was so that the statement written in their law might be fulfilled, ‘They hated me without cause.’
JOH 15:26 “Now when the Enabler comes, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of the Truth who proceeds from the Father, He will testify concerning me.
JOH 15:27 And you also will testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.
JOH 16:1 “I have spoken these things to you to avoid your being caused to stumble
JOH 16:2 —they will excommunicate you; indeed, a time is coming when anyone who kills you will think he is offering God service!
JOH 16:3 And they will do these things because they have not known either the Father or me.
JOH 16:4 Now I have told you these things so that when the time comes you may remember that I told you about them; I did not tell you these things from the beginning because I was with you.
JOH 16:5 “Now then, I am going away to Him who sent me, yet none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’
JOH 16:6 But because I have said these things to you, sorrow has filled your heart.
JOH 16:7 Nevertheless I am telling you the truth: it is to your advantage that I go away, because if I do not go away the Enabler will not come to you, but if I do go I will send Him to you.
JOH 16:8 “Now when He comes he will convict the world about sin and about righteousness and about judgment:
JOH 16:9 first about sin, because they do not believe into me;
JOH 16:10 then about righteousness, because I am going away to my Father and you will no longer see me;
JOH 16:11 then about judgment, because the ruler of this world has been judged.
JOH 16:12 “I still have many things to say to you but you cannot bear it now.
JOH 16:13 However, when He, the Spirit of the Truth, has come, He will guide you into all the truth; for He will not speak on His own, but He will speak whatever He hears. He will also communicate to you the things that are coming.
JOH 16:14 He will glorify me because He will take of what is mine and communicate it to you.
JOH 16:15 All that the Father has is mine; that is why I said that He takes from what is mine and will communicate it to you.
JOH 16:16 “In just a little you will not see me, and in another little you will see me, because I am going to the Father.”
JOH 16:17 Then some of His disciples said among themselves: “What is this that He is telling us, ‘In just a little you will not see me, and in another little you will see me,’ and because ‘I am going to the Father’?”
JOH 16:18 So they said: “What is this ‘little’ that He mentions? We do not know what He is talking about.”
JOH 16:19 Well Jesus knew that they were wanting to question Him and said to them: “Are you inquiring among yourselves about what I said, ‘In just a little you will not see me, and in another little you will see me’?
JOH 16:20 Most assuredly I say to you that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice; you will become grieved, but your grief will be turned into joy.
JOH 16:21 When a woman gives birth she has pain, because her time has come; but when the child is born she no longer remembers the anguish, for joy that a human being has been born into the world.
JOH 16:22 So in your turn you are now experiencing grief, but I will see you again and your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy from you.
JOH 16:23 In that day you will not question me about anything. “Most assuredly I say to you that whatever you ask the Father in my name He will give you.
JOH 16:24 Until now you have not asked anything in my name. Ask and you will receive, so that your joy may be made full.
JOH 16:25 “I have told you these things using figures of speech, but a time is coming when I will no longer talk to you with figures of speech; rather I will tell you plainly about the Father.
JOH 16:26 In that day you will ask in my name; I do not say to you that I will request the Father on your behalf,
JOH 16:27 because the Father Himself is fond of you, in that you have become fond of me and have believed that I came forth from God.
JOH 16:28 I did come forth from the Father and have come into the world. I am leaving the world again and am going to the Father.”
JOH 16:29 His disciples say to Him: “Hey, now you are speaking plainly and using no figure of speech!
JOH 16:30 Now we know that you know everything and don't need anyone to question you. By this we believe that you came forth from God.”
JOH 16:31 Jesus answered them: “Do you believe now, really?
JOH 16:32 Listen, an hour is coming, actually it has already arrived, that you will be scattered, each to his own, and you will leave me alone. Yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.
JOH 16:33 I have spoken these things to you so that in me you may have peace. In the world you have oppression; but take heart, I have conquered the world!”
JOH 17:1 Jesus spoke these things, raising His eyes to Heaven and saying: “Father, the hour has come! Glorify Your Son, so that Your Son also may glorify You,
JOH 17:2 just as You gave Him authority over all humanity, so that He will give eternal life to all those whom You have given Him.
JOH 17:3 Now eternal life is this: that they may know You, the only true God, and the One whom You sent—Jesus Christ.
JOH 17:4 I have glorified You on the earth. I have finished the work that You have given me to do.
JOH 17:5 So now, Father, You glorify me by Your side with the glory that I had along with You before the world existed!
JOH 17:6 “I have revealed Your name to the men whom You have given me out of the world. They were Yours and You gave them to me, and they have kept Your word.
JOH 17:7 They now know that everything You have given to me is from You;
JOH 17:8 because I have given them the sayings which You have given to me; and they have received and known for sure that I came forth from You, and they have believed that You sent me.
JOH 17:9 I am praying for them; I am not praying for the world but for those whom You have given me, because they are yours.
JOH 17:10 Actually, all my things are Yours and Yours are mine, and I have been glorified in them.
JOH 17:11 Now I am no longer in the world, yet these are in the world, and I am coming to You. “Holy Father, keep them in Your name which You have given to me, so that they may be one just as we are.
JOH 17:12 While I was with them in the world I kept them in Your name. I protected those whom You gave me, and not one of them was lost except the son of perdition, so that the Scripture might be fulfilled.
JOH 17:13 But now I am coming to You, and I speak these things in the world so that they may have my joy made full in them.
JOH 17:14 “I have given them Your word; and the world has hated them because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
JOH 17:15 I am not asking that You take them out of the world, but that You keep them from the malignant one.
JOH 17:16 They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
JOH 17:17 Sanctify them by Your Truth; Your Word is Truth.
JOH 17:18 Just as You sent me into the world, I also have sent them into the world.
JOH 17:19 And for their sakes I sanctify myself, so that they also may be sanctified in truth.
JOH 17:20 “I pray not only for these, but also for those who believe into me through their word;
JOH 17:21 that they all may be one, just as You, Father, are in me and I in You; that in Us they also may be one, so that the world may believe that You sent me.
JOH 17:22 In fact, the glory that You gave to me I have given to them, so that they may be one just as We are one:
JOH 17:23 I in them and You in me, so that they may be perfected into one; also so that the world may know that You sent me, and have loved them just as You have loved me.
JOH 17:24 “Father, those whom You have given to me, I desire that they also may be with me where I am, so that they may observe my glory, which You have given me, because You loved me before the founding of the world.
JOH 17:25 Righteous Father! Indeed the world has not known You, but I have known You; and these have known that You sent me.
JOH 17:26 Yes, I have made Your name known to them and will make it known, so that the love with which You have loved me may be in them, and I in them.”
JOH 18:1 Having said these things Jesus went out with His disciples across the Kidron ravine, where there was a garden, which He and His disciples entered.
JOH 18:2 Now Judas, the one betraying Him, also knew the place, because Jesus often met there with His disciples.
JOH 18:3 So Judas, having received the detachment of soldiers and operatives from the chief priests and Pharisees, he arrives there with lanterns, torches and weapons.
JOH 18:4 Then Jesus, knowing everything that was going to happen to Him, went forward and said to them, “Who are you looking for?”
JOH 18:5 They answered Him, “Jesus the Natsorean.” Jesus says to them, “I am he.” (Now Judas, His betrayer, was also standing with them.)
JOH 18:6 So when He said to them, “I am he,” they went backward and fell to the ground!
JOH 18:7 Then He asked them again, “Who are you looking for?” And they said, “Jesus the Natsorean.”
JOH 18:8 Jesus answered: “I told you that I am he. So if it is me you are looking for, allow these men to go”
JOH 18:9 (so that the word that He spoke might be fulfilled, “Of those you have given me I did not lose even one”).
JOH 18:10 Then Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it, struck the high priest's servant and cut off his right ear. (The servant's name was Malchus.)
JOH 18:11 So Jesus said to Peter: “Sheathe the sword! The cup that the Father has given me, must I not drink it?”
JOH 18:12 Then the detachment, the commander and the operatives of the Jews arrested Jesus and bound Him.
JOH 18:13 They took Him to Annas first, because he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.
JOH 18:14 (Now Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.)
JOH 18:15 Now Simon Peter kept following Jesus, as also the other disciple. Well that disciple was known to the high priest, so he went into the high priest's courtyard with Jesus.
JOH 18:16 But Peter was left standing outside by the door. So the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the doorkeeper (f), and brought Peter in.
JOH 18:17 So the servant girl, the doorkeeper, says to Peter, “You aren't one of this man's disciples too, are you?” He says, “I am not!”
JOH 18:18 Now the servants and operatives had made a charcoal fire, because it was cold, and they were standing there warming themselves. So Peter stood with them and warmed himself.
JOH 18:19 Then the high priest questioned Jesus about His disciples and about His teaching.
JOH 18:20 Jesus answered him: “I have spoken openly to the world. I always taught in synagogue and temple, where the Jews always congregate, and I have spoken nothing in secret.
JOH 18:21 Why do you question me? Question those who have heard what I spoke to them. Sure, they know what I said.”
JOH 18:22 But upon His saying these things one of the operatives standing by slapped Jesus saying, “Is that how you answer the high priest?”
JOH 18:23 Jesus answered him, “If I spoke wrongly, identify the wrong; but if rightly, why do you hit me?”
JOH 18:24 (Annas had sent Him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.)
JOH 18:25 Well Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. So they said to him, “You aren't one of His disciples too, are you?” So he denied it and said, “I am not!”
JOH 18:26 One of the servants of the high priest, a relative of the one whose ear Peter had sliced, says, “Didn't I see you with Him in the garden?”
JOH 18:27 So Peter denied again, and immediately a rooster crowed.
JOH 18:28 Then they led Jesus from Caiaphas to the Praetorium, and it was early morning. They themselves did not enter the Praetorium, so that they would not be defiled but could eat the Passover.
JOH 18:29 So Pilate went out to them and said, “What accusation do you bring against this man?”
JOH 18:30 In reply they said to him, “If he were not an evil-doer we would not have handed him over to you.”
JOH 18:31 So Pilate said to them, “You take him and judge him according to your law.” So the Jews said to him, “We are not permitted to execute anyone.”
JOH 18:32 (This was to fulfill the statement that Jesus made, indicating what sort of death He was about to die.)
JOH 18:33 Then Pilate went back into the Praetorium, called Jesus and said to Him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
JOH 18:34 Jesus answered him, “Are you saying this on your own, or did others inform you about me?”
JOH 18:35 Pilate answered Him: “I'm not a Jew, am I? Your own nation, that is, the chief priests handed you over to me. What have you done?”
JOH 18:36 Jesus answered: “My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom were of this world, my subjects would fight so that I not be delivered to the Jews; but now my kingdom is not from here.”
JOH 18:37 So Pilate said to Him, “You are a king then?” Jesus answered: “As you say, I am a king; for this I was born. And for this I came into the world, to testify to the Truth. Everyone who is of the Truth hears my voice.”
JOH 18:38 Pilate says to Him, “What is truth?” Upon saying this he went out to the Jews again and says to them: “I find no crime in him at all.
JOH 18:39 Now we have a custom that I should release someone to you at the Passover; so do you want me to release the King of the Jews to you?”
JOH 18:40 Then they all cried out saying, “Not this fellow, but Barabbas!” Well, Barabbas was a bandit!
JOH 19:1 So then Pilate took Jesus and had Him flogged.
JOH 19:2 And the soldiers twisted a crown out of [poisonous] thorns and put it on His head; they also threw a purple robe around Him
JOH 19:3 and started saying, “Hail, O King of the Jews!” And they slapped Him repeatedly.
JOH 19:4 Pilate then went out again and says to them, “Look, I am bringing him out to you so that you may know that I find no crime in him at all.”
JOH 19:5 Then Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe; and Pilate says to them, “Look at the man!”
JOH 19:6 Well when the chief priests and the operatives saw Him they shouted, saying, “Crucify! Crucify him!” Pilate says to them, “You take and crucify him, because I find no crime in him.”
JOH 19:7 The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and according to our law he ought to die, because he made himself ‘Son of God’!”
JOH 19:8 Hey, when Pilate heard this statement he was more afraid than ever!
JOH 19:9 So back into the Praetorium he went and says to Jesus, “Where are you from?” But Jesus did not answer him.
JOH 19:10 So Pilate says to Him: “Are you not speaking to me? Don't you know that I have authority to crucify you and authority to release you?”
JOH 19:11 Jesus answered: “You would have no authority over me at all if it had not been given to you from Above. Therefore the one who handed me over to you has the greater sin.”
JOH 19:12 From that moment Pilate really tried to release Him; but the Jews kept shouting, saying: “If you release this fellow you are no friend of Caesar's! Whoever makes himself a king is opposing Caesar!”
JOH 19:13 Well, upon hearing this statement Pilate led Jesus outside and sat down on the judgment seat, in a place called ‘Stone Pavement’, while in Hebrew ‘Gabatha’
JOH 19:14 (now it was the day of preparation for the Passover; the hour was about six a.m.), and he says to the Jews, “Look at your king!”
JOH 19:15 But they shouted, “Out! Out! Crucify him!” Pilate says to them, “Shall I crucify your king?” The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”
JOH 19:16 So then he handed Him over to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and lead Him away.
JOH 19:17 And carrying His cross He went out to the place called ‘Skull’, which in Hebrew is called ‘Golgotha’;
JOH 19:18 there they crucified Him, and two others with Him, one on either side, with Jesus in the middle.
JOH 19:19 Now Pilate had also written a notice, and put it on the cross; and the inscription was: JESUS THE NATSOREAN THE KING OF THE JEWS.
JOH 19:20 So many of the Jews read this notice, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; further, it was written in Hebrew, Greek and Latin!
JOH 19:21 So the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Don't write, ‘The king of the Jews’, but that the fellow said, ‘I am the king of the Jews.’ ”
JOH 19:22 Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written!”
JOH 19:23 Now when the soldiers had crucified Jesus they took His clothes and made four parts, a part for each soldier. They also took His tunic, but the tunic was seamless, woven in one piece from the top.
JOH 19:24 So they said among themselves, “Let's not rip it, but toss for it, to see whose it will be,” so that the Scripture might be fulfilled which says: “They divided my clothes among themselves, and for my clothing they cast a lot.” That is why the soldiers did these things.
JOH 19:25 Now Jesus' mother and her sister, Mary of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene were standing by His cross.
JOH 19:26 So Jesus, seeing His mother, and the disciple whom He loved standing by, He says to His mother, “Woman, there is your son!”
JOH 19:27 Then He says to the disciple, “There is your mother!” And from that hour the disciple took her into his home.
JOH 19:28 After this, knowing that everything was now accomplished so that the Scripture might be fulfilled, Jesus says, “I'm thirsty!”
JOH 19:29 Now a vessel full of sour wine was sitting there; so they filled a sponge with sour wine, placed it on a hyssop, and put it to His mouth.
JOH 19:30 Then, when He had received the sour wine, Jesus said, “Paid in full!!” And bowing His head He dismissed His spirit.
JOH 19:31 Now then, because it was Preparation Day, so that the bodies should not remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a high day), the Jews requested Pilate that their legs might be broken and they be removed.
JOH 19:32 Then the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man and of the other one who had been crucified with Him.
JOH 19:33 But upon coming to Jesus, they did not break His legs, since they saw that He had already died.
JOH 19:34 But one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.
JOH 19:35 And the one who saw has testified, and his testimony is true (yes, he knows he is telling the truth), so that you may believe.
JOH 19:36 Because these things happened so that the Scripture should be fulfilled: “Not a bone of His will be broken.”
JOH 19:37 And again another Scripture says: “They will look on Him whom they pierced.”
JOH 19:38 After these things Joseph, the one from Arimathea (being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews), requested Pilate that he might remove the body of Jesus; and Pilate gave permission. So he came and removed Jesus' body.
JOH 19:39 Now Nicodemus also came (the one who at first came to Jesus by night), bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds.
JOH 19:40 Then they took Jesus' body and wrapped it in linen strips, with the aromatic spices, according to the burial custom of the Jews.
JOH 19:41 Now at the place where He was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb in which no one had yet been buried.
JOH 19:42 So that is where they put Jesus, because of the Jews' Preparation Day, since the tomb was nearby.
JOH 20:1 Now on the first day of the week Mary Magdalene comes to the tomb early, while it is still dark, and sees that the stone has been removed from the tomb.
JOH 20:2 So she runs and comes to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and says to them, “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don't know where they put Him!”
JOH 20:3 So Peter and the other disciple took off, heading for the tomb.
JOH 20:4 Well the two started running together, and the other disciple outran Peter and got to the tomb first.
JOH 20:5 And stooping to look he sees the linen strips lying there; however he did not go in.
JOH 20:6 Then following him comes Simon Peter and went into the tomb; and he sees the linen strips lying there,
JOH 20:7 and the facecloth that had been on His head not lying with the linen strips, but folded up in a separate place.
JOH 20:8 So then the other disciple went in too, the one who got to the tomb first; and he saw and believed.
JOH 20:9 (For they did not yet know the Scripture, that He had to rise from among the dead.)
JOH 20:10 Then the disciples went back home.
JOH 20:11 Well Mary stood outside at the tomb, crying. Then, while she was crying, she stooped to look into the tomb.
JOH 20:12 And she sees two angels in white, sitting one at the head and one at the feet of where the body of Jesus had lain.
JOH 20:13 And they say to her, “Woman, why are you crying?” She says to them, “Because they removed my Lord, and I don't know where they put Him.”
JOH 20:14 And upon saying this she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, yet did not know that it was Jesus.
JOH 20:15 Jesus says to her: “Woman, why are you crying? Whom are you seeking?” She, supposing that He was the gardener, says to Him, “Sir, if you carried Him away, tell me where you put Him, and I will remove Him.”
JOH 20:16 Jesus says to her, “Mary!” Turning she says to Him, “Raboni!” (which means ‘Teacher’).
JOH 20:17 Jesus says to her: “Stop clinging to me, for I have not yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brothers and say to them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father—my God and your God.’ ”
JOH 20:18 Mary Magdalene goes to the disciples, reporting that she had seen the Lord and He had said these things to her.
JOH 20:19 Then at evening on that first day of the week, the doors being locked where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the middle, and He says to them, “Peace to you!”
JOH 20:20 And upon saying this He showed them His hands and His side. Well, the disciples were overjoyed when they saw the Lord!
JOH 20:21 So Jesus said to them again: “Peace to you! Just as the Father sent me, I also send you.”
JOH 20:22 Upon saying this He breathed on them and said: “Receive Holy Spirit!
JOH 20:23 To whomever you forgive the sins, they are forgiven to them; to whomever you retain, they have been retained.”
JOH 20:24 Now one of the twelve, Thomas (called Twin), was not with them when Jesus came.
JOH 20:25 So the other disciples said to him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them, “If I do not see the nail prints in His hands and put my finger into the nail prints, and put my hand into His side, I will not believe!”
JOH 20:26 Well after eight days His disciples were inside again, and Thomas with them. The doors were locked [again]; Jesus came and stood in the middle, and said, “Peace to you!”
JOH 20:27 Then He says to Thomas: “Bring your finger here and perceive my hands; bring your hand and put it into my side; do not be unbelieving but believing!”
JOH 20:28 Thomas answered and said to Him, “My Lord and my God!”
JOH 20:29 Jesus says to him: “Because you have observed me, you have believed. Blessed are those who believe without seeing!”
JOH 20:30 Now then, Jesus actually performed many other miraculous signs in the presence of His disciples, that are not written in this book;
JOH 20:31 but these have been written so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have Life through His Name.
JOH 21:1 After these things Jesus, risen from the dead, revealed Himself to His disciples at the Sea of Tiberias, and He did it like this:
JOH 21:2 Simon Peter, Thomas (called Twin), Nathanael (from Cana of Galilee), Zebedee's sons and two others of His disciples were together.
JOH 21:3 Simon Peter says to them, “I'm going fishing.” They say to him, “We're coming with you.” Off they went and got right into the boat, and that whole night they caught nothing.
JOH 21:4 Well when daybreak had now come Jesus stood on the beach; however the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.
JOH 21:5 Then Jesus says to them, “Boys, you don't have any food, do you?” They answered Him, “No.”
JOH 21:6 So He said to them, “Cast the net on the right side of the boat and you will find.” So they did, and now they were unable to haul it in because of the multitude of fish!
JOH 21:7 Then that disciple whom Jesus loved says to Peter, “It's the Lord!” Upon hearing that it was the Lord, Simon Peter tied on his outer garment (for he was stripped) and plunged into the sea.
JOH 21:8 But the other disciples came in the little boat dragging the net with the fish (for they were not far from the land, but about 100 yards).
JOH 21:9 Then, as they stepped onto the land they saw a charcoal fire in place with fish lying on it, and bread.
JOH 21:10 Jesus says to them, “Bring some of the fish that you have just caught.”
JOH 21:11 Simon Peter got up and dragged the net onto the land, full of one hundred and fifty-three large fish [!]; and although being so many, the net was not torn.
JOH 21:12 Jesus says to them, “Come have breakfast!” Well not one of the disciples dared to ask Him, “Who are you?”—knowing that it was the Lord.
JOH 21:13 Then Jesus comes and takes the bread and gives it to them, as also the fish.
JOH 21:14 This was already a third time that Jesus appeared to His disciples after He was raised from among the dead.
JOH 21:15 So, when they had eaten breakfast, Jesus says to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me more than these?” He says to Him, “Yes, Lord, you know that I'm fond of you.” He says to him, “Feed my lambs.”
JOH 21:16 He says to him again, a second time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me?” He says to Him, “Yes, Lord, you know that I'm fond of you.” He says to him, “Shepherd my sheep.”
JOH 21:17 The third time He says to him, “Simon, son of Jonah, are you fond of me?” Peter was grieved in that the third time He said to him, “Are you fond of me?” and said to Him: “Lord, you know all things. You know that I'm fond of you!” Jesus says to him: “Feed my sheep.
JOH 21:18 Most assuredly I say to you, when you were younger you used to get dressed and walk where you wished; but when you are old you will stretch out your hands and another will dress you and carry you where you do not wish.”
JOH 21:19 (He said this to indicate the kind of death by which he would glorify God.) And upon saying that He says to him, “Follow me!”
JOH 21:20 But turning around Peter sees the disciple whom Jesus loved following (that is the one who reclined on His chest at the supper and said, “Lord, who is the one who is betraying you?”).
JOH 21:21 Seeing him, Peter says to Jesus, “Lord, what about him?”
JOH 21:22 Jesus says to him: “If I want him to remain until I come, what is that to you? You follow me.”
JOH 21:23 So this saying spread among the brothers, that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him [Peter] that he [John] would not die, but, “If I want him to remain until I come, what is that to you?”
JOH 21:24 This is the disciple who is testifying to these things, and who wrote them; and we know that his testimony is true.
JOH 21:25 Indeed, there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if they were written one by one, I suppose that not even the whole world could contain the books that would be written! Amen.
ACT 1:1 The first account I prepared, Theophilus [God-lover], concerned all that Jesus began to do and to teach
ACT 1:2 until the day in which He was taken back, after He had given commandment, by Holy Spirit, to the apostles whom He had chosen;
ACT 1:3 to whom He also showed Himself alive, after His suffering, by many convincing evidences, appearing to them during forty days and speaking of things pertaining to the Kingdom of God.
ACT 1:4 And being together He directed them not to go away from Jerusalem, but to wait for the promise of the Father, “which you heard from me;
ACT 1:5 John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with Holy Spirit not many days from now.”
ACT 1:6 Well then, being together they asked Him saying, “Lord, are you going to restore the kingdom to Israel at this time?”
ACT 1:7 So He said to them: “It is not for you to know times or seasons that the Father has placed within His own authority.
ACT 1:8 But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you; and you will be witnesses to me—both in Jerusalem, and all Judea and Samaria, and even to the last part of the earth.”
ACT 1:9 Upon saying these things, as they watched, He was lifted up, and a cloud took Him out of their sight.
ACT 1:10 And as they were staring into the sky, while He was going, suddenly two men in white clothing stood beside them;
ACT 1:11 and they said: “Men of Galilee, why do you stand gazing up into the sky? This very Jesus who is being taken up from you into the sky, He will come again in the precise manner that you observed Him going into the sky.”
ACT 1:12 They then returned to Jerusalem from the mount called ‘of Olives’, which is near Jerusalem (a Sabbath day's journey).
ACT 1:13 When they had entered [the city] they went up into the upper room where they were staying: namely Peter and James, John and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot, and Judas of James.
ACT 1:14 All these were continuing with one purpose in prayer and petition, along with the women, including Mary the mother of Jesus, and with His brothers.
ACT 1:15 Well in those days Peter stood up in the middle of the disciples (the number of people assembled there was about 120) and said:
ACT 1:16 “Men, brothers: It was necessary that this Scripture be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke before by David's mouth concerning Judas, who was guide to those who arrested Jesus;
ACT 1:17 in that he was numbered with us and obtained his share in this ministry.”
ACT 1:18 (In fact this man acquired a field with the wages of his wickedness, and falling headlong he burst open in the middle, and all his innards were spilled out.
ACT 1:19 And it became known to all who lived in Jerusalem, so that in their own language that field came to be called ‘Akeldama’, that is, ‘Field of Blood’.)
ACT 1:20 “Because it stands written in Book of Psalms: ‘Let his residence become desolate, and may no one live in it’ and, ‘Let another take his office.’
ACT 1:21 So then, of the men who have accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,
ACT 1:22 beginning from the baptism of John until the day when He was taken up from us, of these one must become a witness with us of His resurrection.”
ACT 1:23 So they nominated two, Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.
ACT 1:24 And praying they said: “You, Lord, Knower of all hearts, show which one of these two You have chosen
ACT 1:25 to receive the portion of this ministry and apostleship, out of which Judas turned aside to go into his own place.”
ACT 1:26 And they cast their lots, and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was numbered with the eleven Apostles.
ACT 2:1 When the day of Pentecost had come, they were all together with one purpose.
ACT 2:2 And suddenly a roar came out of the sky, like the rushing of a violent wind, and it filled the whole house where they were sitting.
ACT 2:3 Fiery tongues appeared and were distributed to them, and it [a tongue] landed on each one of them.
ACT 2:4 And they were all filled with Holy Spirit and began to speak different languages, as the Spirit was granting to them to speak out.
ACT 2:5 Now there were devout men, Jews, from every nation under heaven, dwelling in Jerusalem.
ACT 2:6 So when that roar occurred, the crowd came together, and was bewildered, because each one was hearing them speaking to him in his own dialect.
ACT 2:7 So they were amazed and marveled, saying to one another: “Hey, aren't all these who are speaking Galileans?
ACT 2:8 So how can each of us be hearing our own dialect in which we were born?
ACT 2:9 Parthians and Medes and Elamites; those dwelling in Mesopotamia, in Judea and Cappadocia, in Pontus and Asia,
ACT 2:10 in Phrygia and Pamphylia, in Egypt and the parts of Libya adjoining Cyrene; and visitors from Rome—both Jews and proselytes—
ACT 2:11 Cretans and Arabians; we hear them declaring the great works of God in our own languages.”
ACT 2:12 Yes they were all amazed and perplexed, saying one to another, “Whatever is going on?”
ACT 2:13 But different ones were jeering, saying, “They are full of sweet wine!”
ACT 2:14 So Peter, standing with the eleven, raised his voice and proclaimed to them: “Men—Jews and all who are dwelling in Jerusalem—let this be known to you; indeed, listen to my speech!
ACT 2:15 Because these are not drunk, as you suppose (since it is only the third hour of the day),
ACT 2:16 but this is what was spoken through the prophet Joel:
ACT 2:17 ‘It will be in the last days, says God: I will pour out from my Spirit upon all flesh; your sons and your daughters will prophesy; your young men will see visions; your old men will dream a dream.
ACT 2:18 In those days I will indeed pour out from my Spirit upon my male slaves and upon my female slaves, and they will prophesy.
ACT 2:19 I will show wonders in the heaven above and signs on the earth below: blood and fire and smoke vapor.
ACT 2:20 The sun will be turned into darkness and the moon into ‘blood’ before the great and glorious day of the Lord will come.
ACT 2:21 And it will be: whoever calls on the name of the Lord will be saved!’
ACT 2:22 “Men of Israel, listen to these words: Jesus the Natsorean, a man from God attested to you by miracles and wonders and signs, which God did by Him in your midst, as you yourselves well know,
ACT 2:23 Him—being delivered up by the established purpose and foreknowledge of God—you murdered, having taken Him with lawless hands and crucified Him;
ACT 2:24 whom God raised up, ending the labor pains of death, because it was not possible that He should be held by it.
ACT 2:25 For David says concerning Him: ‘I always saw the Lord before my face, because He is at my right side so that I not be shaken.
ACT 2:26 Therefore my heart was glad and my tongue rejoiced. Furthermore, even my flesh will repose upon hope,
ACT 2:27 because You will not abandon my soul in Hades, nor will You allow Your Holy One to see decay.
ACT 2:28 You have made known to me roads of life; with Your presence You make me full of gladness.’
ACT 2:29 “Men, brothers, be it permitted to speak to you plainly about the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.
ACT 2:30 So then, he being a prophet and knowing that God had sworn to him with an oath that of the fruit, according to flesh, of his loins He would raise up the Messiah to sit on his throne,
ACT 2:31 he foreseeing this spoke about the resurrection of the Messiah, that His soul was not abandoned in Hades, nor did His flesh see decay.
ACT 2:32 “This Jesus God raised, to which we all are witnesses.
ACT 2:33 Therefore, having been exalted to God's right hand, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, He poured out this that you now see and hear.
ACT 2:34 Further, David did not ascend into the heavens, but he himself says: ‘The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at my right hand
ACT 2:35 until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.’
ACT 2:36 Therefore, let all the house of Israel know assuredly that God has made Him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom you crucified!”
ACT 2:37 Now upon hearing this they were cut to the heart and said to Peter, and the rest of the Apostles, “Men, brothers, what shall we do?!”
ACT 2:38 So Peter said to them: “Repent and be baptized, each one of you, upon the name of Jesus Christ, for forgiveness of sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
ACT 2:39 For the promise is to you, and to your children, and to all who are far away—as many, that is, as the Lord our God may call.”
ACT 2:40 With many different words he both testified and kept exhorting, saying, “Escape from this perverse generation!”
ACT 2:41 Then those who gladly received his word were baptized, and that day about three thousand souls were added.
ACT 2:42 And they continued steadfastly in the Apostles' teaching and in the fellowship, both in the breaking of the bread and in the prayers.
ACT 2:43 Fear came upon every soul—many wonders and signs were taking place through the Apostles.
ACT 2:44 Now all who believed were together and had all things in common;
ACT 2:45 they started selling both possessions and goods and were distributing to all according as anyone had need.
ACT 2:46 So day by day they continued steadfastly with one purpose in the temple and broke bread from house to house; they received their share of food with gladness and singleness of heart,
ACT 2:47 praising God and having favor with all the people. And day by day the Lord added to the Church those who were being saved.
ACT 3:1 Now Peter and John were going up together into the temple at the hour (the ninth) of prayer.
ACT 3:2 And a certain man, who had actually been lame from his mother's womb, was being carried (they would lay him daily at the temple gate, the one called Beautiful, to ask alms from those who entered the temple),
ACT 3:3 who, upon seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, began asking for alms.
ACT 3:4 So Peter, with John, fastening his gaze on him said, “Look at us.”
ACT 3:5 So he gave them his attention, expecting to receive something from them.
ACT 3:6 But Peter said: “I do not have silver and gold, but what I do have I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ the Natsorean, get up and walk!”
ACT 3:7 And grasping him by his right hand he lifted him up; immediately his feet and ankles were strengthened.
ACT 3:8 So jumping up he stood, and began to walk! And he entered the temple with them, walking and leaping and praising God.
ACT 3:9 Well all the people saw him walking and praising God;
ACT 3:10 and they recognized him—that he was the one who used to sit at the Beautiful Gate of the temple, with a view to alms—and they were filled with wonder and amazement because of what had happened to him.
ACT 3:11 Now as the lame man who had been healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the portico, the one called ‘Solomon's’, really wondering.
ACT 3:12 So upon observing this Peter responded to the people: “Men of Israel, why are you marveling at this, or why are you staring at us as if we have made him walk by our own power or godliness?
ACT 3:13 The God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, the God of our fathers, glorified His Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up; and you repudiated Him to Pilate's face, when he was intending to release Him.
ACT 3:14 Yes you repudiated the holy and righteous One, and you asked that a murderer be granted to you,
ACT 3:15 while you killed the Originator of the Life, whom God raised from among the dead, to which we are witnesses.
ACT 3:16 Well His name, based on faith in His name, made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith that is through Him has given him this wholeness in the presence of you all.
ACT 3:17 “So now, brothers, I know that you did it in ignorance, as also your rulers.
ACT 3:18 But the things that God foretold through the mouth of all His prophets, that the Messiah would suffer, He has thus fulfilled.
ACT 3:19 Repent therefore, and turn around, so that your sins may be erased, in order that times of refreshing may come from the Lord's face
ACT 3:20 and that He may send Jesus, who had been ordained to be your Messiah,
ACT 3:21 whom Heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, of which times God spoke long ago by the mouth of all His holy prophets.
ACT 3:22 “For example, Moses said to the fathers: ‘The Lord our God will raise up for you a Prophet, like me, from among your brothers. You must listen to Him, in all that He may say to you.
ACT 3:23 It will be that every person who will not listen to that Prophet will be extirpated from among the people.’
ACT 3:24 “Yes and all the prophets, from Samuel on down, as many as have spoken, have also foretold these days.
